loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura is a resident of Xujand town. He is 54 years old and lives with his family

For 5 years, he has been engaged in the building business. His wife is businesswoman who sells clothing. They have only one son who is 19 years old.  

Jura is a caring father; he is working very hard for his son's future. His son studies at the university in the economics faculty. Now he must pay for his education, but he does not have enough money. That is why Jura wants to access credit.

As Jura said, his son is a diligent and responsible person. With the help of Kiva lenders, he will be able to continue his education and, in the future, become a good specialist.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of two children and both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother).  

She has business of selling food, and has been in this business for three years.She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more food staffs like cabbages, bunches of green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

She works in the market seven days out of every week, and sells on both retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages, bunches of green bananas, sweet and irish potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is married with two children who do not attend school. She also takes care of a niece. She has had a retail business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and ground nuts. She sells both retail and wholesale six days per week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

She generates additional income from rental rooms. She aspires to own a wholesale business and to build more rental rooms. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because it is flexible. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and paying for utility bills

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, rice and ground nuts.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan had enhanced his business. He was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase his inventory. The loan also helped him provide for his family’s daily needs.

He is very positive that he could improve his more business if you will lend him an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional groceries, toiletries and beverages. His customers will likely to buy more items if he has more of his products displayed on his store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in his business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, he could sustain the needs of his family.

Aside from growing his business, Vladimir wants his family to always stick together and develop a deep sense of closeness to God. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products to sell at retail.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She lives in the province of Leyte, Philippines.

Virginia has been running a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place for more than three years now.

As of now, Virginia is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, and snack foods. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store.

In the future, Virginia hopes to improve their standard of living. She also wants to save money for her children’s schooling

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, condiments, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Foday. He is married and has 3 children, ages 19, 16, and 11. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him for schooling.

In 2001, Foday established his Patient Drug business. He began his business just to provide adequate support for his children and wife. His business is located at the city center and his main customers are all classes of business people. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL a month from this business. 

Foday would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy two cartons of Panadol (tabs) 500,000, Amoxcilline (cap) 500,000 and Ampicilline (cap) 500,000. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock levels. 

In the future, Foday plans to educate his children and to create a business for his wife. He has been delayed in his goals of creating a business for his wife and also in educating his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for his pharmacy for resale

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es: Banco Mujer Mujeres de Fe, solicita su segundo crédito, el grupo actualmente cuenta con 8 socias todas con ideas productivas ya iniciadas, y con carácter empresarial para sacar adelante sus emprendimientos. Las actividades que desarrollan son pecuarias y comerciales. Kimberly es parte de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy joven con un niño de tan solo un año de edad. Es jefa de hogar y su actividad es la que le permite solventar los gastos básicos de ella y su niño, cuenta solo con una pequeña pensión que le brinda el padre de su hijo. Esta mujer tan valiente se dedica a la cria y desarrollo de cerdos, con el primer crédito logro consolidar su negocio, y para está nueva inversión piensa aumentar su producción comprando más animales y los insumos necesarios para su desarrollo. Las aspiraciones de Kimberly son muchas pero principalmente que su actividad sigan siendo el autoempleo que tanto necesita para poder ver a su hijo sin tener que salir de su casa.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Fe Bank is applying for its second loan. Currently, the group has 8 members, all with productive ideas already begun, and with business natures to succeed in their undertakings. The activities that they carry out are livestock and trade. 

Kimberly is part of this group. She is a very young woman with a child who is only 1 year old. She is the head of her household and her activity is one that allows her to pay her and her child’s basic expenses. She counts on only a small pension that the father of her son provides her. 

This woman who is so brave makes a living raising and breeding pigs. With the first loan, she was able to consolidate her business, and with this new investment she is thinking of increasing her production purchasing more animals and the supplies necessary for its development. Kimberly’s aspirations are many, but mainly that her activity continues to be the self-employment that she needs so much to be able to see her child without having to leave her home.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed, pellets, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Dary es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, la mayor de 14 años el menor de 12 años, el niño se encuentran estudiando y la chica ya no estudia, Dary se dedica a la venta de ropa y también trabaja de ayudante  en la cocina, en la venta de ropa y en cualquier actividad que tenga que realizar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa, Dary espera mejorar su negocio, aumentar sus ventar para poder darles a sus hijos le necesario.
texts.en:
At 33 years old, Dary is a single mother. She has 2 children, the eldest of which is 14 years old and the youngest 12 years old. The boy is studying and the girl is not studying anymore. 

Dary makes a living from selling clothes and she also works as an assistant in the kitchen, selling clothes, and in whichever activity that she has to perform. 

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing. Dary hopes to improve her business and increase her sales to be able to give everything necessary to her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 50 years old. He is married with two children, aged 12 and 30 years old. One child attends school.  

He has farmed for 35 years, and will use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to grow beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and buy cows.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy notebooks, uniforms, shoes, and other items so that her children can attend school

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
José, de 67 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, se creció con sus padres y por problemas económicos en su familia el emigro hacia Estados Unidos en el año 1,990, trabajo y vivió haya alrededor de 8 años.- En 1,998 regreso a este país, actualmente está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar de sus tres hijos.

Él se dedica actualmente, a los diferentes trabajos de la agricultura; siembra pepino, tomates, yuca, maíz y frijoles.- Dichos trabajos los realiza desde hace 15 años, aprendió gracias a que sus padres le enseñaron cuando él estaba pequeño. Sus cultivos los realiza en la comunidad.

José, invertirá el dinero para comprar semillas, abono y otros insumos agrícolas para sembrar hortalizas y de esta manera mejorar los ingresos económicos en su hogar  y a la vez mejorar sus condiciones y calidad de vida junto a su familia.

José, sueña con seguir con su cultivo de hortalizas, para aumentar la producción y obtener más ingresos económicos y arreglar su vivienda, para poder  brindarle más seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 67 years old and studied through the third grade.  He grew up with his family, but because of economic reasons he migrated to the U.S. in 1990 and worked and lived there for around 8 years.  In 1998 he returned to El Salvador, and currently he lives with his life partner who works taking care of their home and their three children.

He currently works in agriculture doing various jobs: he grown cucumber, tomatoes, yucca, corn, and beans.  He has been working with these crops for 15 years.  He learned thanks to his parents who taught him while he was young.  He plants his crops in the community. 
 
José will invest his loan in purchasing seeds, fertilizer and agricultural feed in order to grow his crops and in this way improve his income and the economic situation of his home while improving the living conditions of his family.

José dreams of cultivating great crops, increasing production, and obtaining greater income that will help him fix his home and offer greater security to his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other agricultural products in order to grow his vegetable crops.

loans.name: Bett

texts.en:
Bett is a farmer, born in 1983, who lives in a small village in northern Kenya called Kapletundo.

In this rural location, he owns a two-acre piece of land that he uses to grow tomatoes and maize. He also keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He has been selling his produce a few kilometers away at the Market since he started farming in 2002.

Bett is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The cow will produce 10 to 15 litres of milk every day that will be sold at the market. Money from these sales will go to loan repayment and other business expenses. Any profits from this investment will be returned to his business to propel growth.

Your loan will have a great impact on Bett’s life. His hard work thus far has seen him take great care of his children, his lovely wife Norah, and one employee. With your loan, he hopes to improve his family's livelihood and continue to impact society in a positive manner.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of sweet breads and french bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, propane gas and lime.

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es:
Sandra, ha mantenido su negocio de venta de fruta congelada cubierta de chocolate y bebidas refrescantes en el mercado con la ayuda del crédito anterior, su familia se mantiene y cuenta con más clientes.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar jugos, gaseosas, agua, pasta de chocolate, pinchos, fresas, guineos, bolsas, etc., así elaborara la venta y mantendrá la continuidad de su buen servicio.
texts.en: Sandra has been able to maintain her business selling frozen chocolate covered fruit and refreshing drinks at the market thanks to the help from her previous loan.  She has been able to maintain her family and she now has more customers.  She is asking for a new loan in order to buy juices, soft drinks, chocolate sauce, tooth picks, strawberries, bananas, plastic bags, etc.  In this way she will increase sales and maintain continuity with her good service.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, chocolate sauce, tooth picks, strawberries, bananas, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Gabriela

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 7 años que están estudiando en la escuela de la localidad, ella es una mujer responsable que ama a su familia, se dedica a criar vacas de leche  para vender este producto y obtener los ingresos para comprar todo lo necesario para la   alimentación de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, su esposo trabaja de chofer, y comenta que  juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos. Veronica comenta que le va bien en su negocio ya que cuida muy bien a sus animales. En el futuro Veronica espera que su negocio crezca y lo que más desea es tener los ingresos suficientes para que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en: Verónica is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her two children ages 8 and 7.  They are studying at the local school.  She is a responsible woman who loves her family.  She works raising milking cows in order to sell milk and she obtains income sufficient to purchase food for her family and education for her children.  Her husband is a driver and notes that together they are able to help their children get ahead.  Veronica comments that things are going well in her business since she cares for her animals very well.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase one milking cow.  In the future Veronica hopes that her business will grow and that she will have sufficient income so that her children can continue to study.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rosa Candida

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre de un hijo, el cual se graduó de bachillerato y vive con ella en su casa, ya que su esposo hace algunos años falleció.
 
Rosa, se dedica a la sastrería, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a un curso implementado por una ONG que llego a su municipio, este trabajo le parece muy bueno, ya que trabaja con el gobierno elaborando uniformes escolares y el trabajo lo hace en su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de costura como hilos, botones y agujas, que le ayudaran a confeccionar sus prendas.

El sueño de Rosa es mejorar su vivienda, para ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. She is the mother of one son, who has finished high school and lives with her in her home. Her husband died a few years ago.

Rosa earns her living as a seamstress, a trade that she learned thanks to a course that was implemented by a non-profit that operated in her township. This kind of work seems good to her: she contracts with the government making school uniforms and she does her work at home.

She needs this loan to buy sewing materials, such as thread, buttons and needles that will be used to make garments.  Rosa’s dream is to improve her housing, to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as thread, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Sulejman

texts.en:
Sulejman now wants to buy a dairy cow so that he can cover his kids' dairy needs. He will leave it at his parents' in the village, since he works in the city himself. He does transportation, and this allows him to visit his parents almost every day of the week. 

This way he will be able to take the dairy from the parents to the home.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Antony's Group

texts.en:
Antony is 51 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Antony has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Antony also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Antony's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es: Lorena es madre soltera, ella  cruza los 24 años de edad y su hijo tiene 3 años, Lorena tiene su negocio que es la realización de postres desde hace 2 años atrás, Lorena vive con su madre y su hijo, Lorena necesita el crédito parar comprar frutas, azúcar leche y demás productos que utiliza para realizar sus postres, comenta que los vende a veces entregando a otras jóvenes que ellas los revenden y  otras  veces ofreciendo a quien desee comprar, Lorena aspira mejorar su negocio seguir adelante y tener ingresos para darle a su hijo le indispensable.
texts.en:
Lorena is a single mother. She is just 24 years old and her child is 3 years old. Lorena has had her business, which is the production of desserts, for 2 years. Lorena lives with her mother and her child. 

Lorena needs the loan to purchase fruit, sugar, milk, and other products that she uses to make her desserts. She comments that she sells them sometimes by giving them to other young women for them to resell them, and other times she offers them to whomever wishes to purchase them. 

Lorena aspires to improve her business, to continue on, and to have an income to give her child what he needs.

loans.use: to purchase products to make desserts.

loans.name: Ylli

texts.en:
Ylli, or ‘star’ in English, wants to pay for the rental of 20 dynyms of agricultural land and he needs your financial help to achieve that goal.

Ylli is a 50-year-old villager and a married father of a 17-year-old and a 15-year-old. He has been pursuing agriculture/livestock to earn a living for his family.

Currently he has two milk cows, from which he sells about 45 liters of raw milk a day, at a price of $0.80 per liter and a half. He also has 20 dynym of agricultural land where he plants fodder on 6 dynyms, vetch on another 6 dynyms, and corn, wheat and rye on the rest of the land.

On the 20 dynyms of land that he would like to rent from some other villagers (who have moved to the city and do nothing with the land), he plans to plant the same things, because he has seen profits from his experience so far.

loans.use: to rent some agricultural land from other villagers who are not using it at the moment

loans.name: Waluyo

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Waluyo, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Waluyo is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with three children. 

He owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile phone sim cards, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payments service to his community.

Waluyo joined Ruma about four months ago because he wanted to improve his business and expand his network.

As the business runs, Waluyo is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the photo, Waluyo is sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Montebello, Leyte. 

She has engaged in the hog-raising business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Meriam is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and also animal feed. A loan will help her improve her hog raising business as well as her income and profit. 

In the future, Meriam hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and also animal feed

loans.name: Yokutoi

texts.en:
Yokutoi is an honest woman. She was born in 1978. She is living in a small town. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a master. 

She is a sewer. Yokutoi sews traditional dresses for women. She has a great number of satisfied customers. She is experienced, generous and confident person. She tries to do best of her in decoration of dresses. 

Basically she sews diverse beautiful dresses for brides. She wants to increase her work and make better standard of living. She is asking for financial support to buy fabrics for increasing working capital.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for increasing working capital

loans.name: Babilonia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BABILONIA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa americana, tienda de carnicería, venta de comida, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, a quien ayudaba desde niña, es por ello que decide implementar un negocio independiente ya que conocía la forma de comercio de este producto. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y el crédito que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se identifica la ausencia de un cliente, el mismo se marcho con urgencia por imprevisto en su negocio.
texts.en:
The A.C. “BABILONIA” will begin their first cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman), as part of the Centro Focal of Senkata.  It is made of eight members, and it is headed by the board where Señora Verónica is the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal association carried forward are varied among them: selling vegetables, selling American clothing, a butcher shop, selling food, selling vicuña blankets (a vicuña is similar to a llama), and selling jackets.

The loan that they took out will benefit the small mirco-businesses where Señora Verónica is a member.  She indicated that this is the first time that they have been a part of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling vegetables.  She says that this is a business that she learned from her mother, who she used to help since she was a child.  This is why she decided to implement an independent business now that she knows how to sell this product.

The loan that they will take out now is to increase the capital (to buy wholesale vegetables) that she will acquire from the wholesale venders in the city of La Paz and subsequently sell in her stall.  This job allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area, the training, and the loan that the institution offers.

In the image one will notice the absence of a member.  He had to leave with due to an unexpected urgency in his business.

loans.use: To buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.name: Om Reaham  Al-Wady Group

texts.en:
Hayat is the leader of Om Reaham AL-Wady group which is made up of four members of women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Kiva's partner, AMB.  

Hayat is a 35-year-old married women who lives with her family in a small house and her husband works as a soldier. His income is not enough to make the necessary expansion of the house. Hayat wanted to help him in make that expanding. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do. 

For this reason, Hayat is asking a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase construction materials to build an extra room. Hayat hopes to renovate all her house on the inside.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build an extra room.

loans.name: Emina

texts.en:
Emina is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Saidabad Region. Her children are young and all of them are married. Emina has a big fruit garden. She loves her garden and always takes care of her land. She has been growing fruit and vegetables for a long time. Her husband helps her. She also has two cows. Emina sells milk, fruit, and vegetables in the local bazaar. Her monthly income is 150 AZN.

She is a hardworking woman. She always tries to provide her family with a high standard of living. But this income does not cover her family's situation. She needs to improve her business to buy new sorts of trees, seed and fertilizer, to get more crops. Emina applied for a loan of 800 AZN from  Aqroinvest  Credit Union. It is her first loan with Aqroinvest.

loans.use: to buy new sorts of trees, seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Palomas De Suriquina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMAS DE SURIQUINA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de colchones de paja, tienda de barrio, venta de artesanías, venta de cascabeles, venta de varillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de cascabeles para trajes florkloricos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, quienes comercializaban estos materiales como negocio familiar, posteriormente ella decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fierros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará sus productos a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella aún es soltera.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Palomas de Suriquina” (Doves of Suriquina) will begin the second cycle in Pro Mujer (Pro Woman) as part of the Centro Focal of Achacachi.  It is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Señora Sandra is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal association have are varied among them: selling straw mattresses, general store, selling handicrafts, selling bells, selling rods. 

The loan that they took out will benefit the small micro-entrepreneurs where Señora Sandra is a member.  She said that this is the first time that she had been a part of Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a massive promotion of the institution that they conducted in her area.  Currently she has a business making and selling bells for folk costumes.  She says that she learned this business several years ago from her parents who sold these materials as a family business.  Subsequently, she decided to implement an independent business.  
 
The loan that she will take out is to increase the capital (to buy wholesale iron) that she will acquire from wholesale vender in the city of La Paz and subsequently make into bells to sell her products at the request of her customers.  This job allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, since she is still single.  

Whe asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale iron.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of the country. She is married. She lives with her family. She has one child. Her husband is a cook.

Lola has great experience in baking pasties. For almost twelve years she has been baking pasties and patties to sell. She has a place in the domestic market to sell her product. Additionally she prepares hot tea and coffee for clients. She is planning to enlarge her activity. She wants to serve more clients and to bake other kinds of pastries to sell. She has a lot of satisfied clients.

Lola is asking for financial support to buy building materials to repair her business location and to buy food products to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her business location and to buy food products to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Luis Eugenio

texts.es:
Luis, vive con sus familiares, su esposa tiene 31 años de edad y sus hijos 5 y 2 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a las actividades del hogar y también le ayuda en su negocio, el cual consiste en atender una carpintería, el producto principal que elabora son ataúdes y pedidos especiales de sus clientes, no tiene un horario establecido.
Invertirá en la compra de madera, telas, clavos, pegamento, barniz, etc., adquirirá materiales para elaborar ataúdes y otros muebles que le han encargado en esta temporada, espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos, brindar puntualidad y buen servicio a sus clientes.
Sus sueños son tener recursos económicos para cancelar sus deudas y dar a sus hijos educación para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his relatives: his wife, 31, and his children, 5 and 2. His wife does the housework and also helps him in his shop, a carpenter's workshop. The main product made there are coffins and special requests from  his clients. He doesn't have an established schedule. 

He will invest in wood, fabrics, nails, glue, varnish, etc, which he will use to make coffins and other pieces that have been ordered from him in this season. He hopes to improve the quality of his products and to give punctuality and good service to his clients. His dream is to have the economic resources to pay off his debts and to give his children education so they have a better future.

loans.use: to buy wood, fabrics, nails, glues, varnish, etc,  which he will use to build coffins and other items which have been ordered from him in this season.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Marie.  She is divorced, and has one child, aged four years.

 In 2012, Marie established her rice and cooking oil business.  She began her business because she wanted additional income to her monthly salary.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  Marie requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice and gallons of cooking oil to expand the business and also to attracted more profit.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 700, 000.  

In the future, Marie plans to develop the business.  Very hard working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Yvette Fay

texts.en:
Yvette Fay signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Candida's Group

texts.en:
Candida is 48 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Candida has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as excellent, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Candida also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Candida's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of five acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is 51 years old and has children who are already working. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, she was able to raise her children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Celia owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP-5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and others. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Celia desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ernest's Group

texts.en:
Ernest is 62 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Ernest has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Ernest also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Ernest's Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Mulih

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Mulih, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Mulih is happily married, and he and his wife have been blessed with two children. 

Mulih owns and manages a small stall that sells groceries, snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service to his community. He joined Ruma about four months ago because he wanted to improve his business and he felt excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma mobile application. 

As the business runs, Mulih is hoping to get working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the near future, Mulih also plans to improve his selling with a new product from Ruma, which is an e-commerce for lower communities called Mapan. By serving Mapan to his customers, Mulih will be able to receive orders from customers who want to buy products that have been listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Mulih will simply send an SMS in a format to an SMS center; the customer will pay him, and a Ruma agent will come to his stall to collect the money. Within 3-5 days, the product will be delivered right to the customer's door. 

With Mapan, Mulih believes that his community will be able to have access to high quality products with better prices; and of course, his stall will be improved more. In the photo, Mulih is sitting in front of his small stall. He was photographed by a Ruma staff member who comes over to his stall to collect money every week.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Timina's Group

texts.en:
Timina is 63 years old and has 9 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Timina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Timina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Timina's Group will be able to receive a total of 3 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar is a 48-year-old gardener. She is married, and she and her husband have a daughter and a son. Her children are studying, but her husband is jobless. The only income for the family comes from Nigar's gardening. Nigar raises different seasonal fruit trees and her husband helps her to sell the fruit at the local bazaar to earn money. Nigar has worked in this area for three years and earns 130AZN monthly.

Nigar loves gardening very much. She does gardening properly and tries to take good care of her trees. Now it's winter and her trees are in danger from harmful snow and rains. Nigar applied for a 1000AZN loan in order to buy materials so she can build a small greenhouse for her garden with her husband.

loans.use: to buy materials and build a small greenhouse for a garden.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Fatimah, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta. Fatimah is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with four children.  Her husband works as a staff in a local company. To support her husband in fulfilling the needs of their family, Fatimah runs a small business selling mobile phone airtime credits and a utility bill payment service. As a stay-at-home mom, Fatimah has an advantage selling to her neighbors because she is close to them and meets them very often.

Fatimah knew Ruma from one of her family who works there. She became interested in joining Ruma because as a woman, she wanted to learn how to improve her business and help her husband support the family. Fatimah joined Ruma four months ago. 
As the business runs, Fatimah is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Fatimah is standing in front of her house, which is where her customers usually come to buy mobile airtime or pay their bills via Fatimah’s mobile application service. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a single mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, Anita has operated an open-air food selling business, selling boiled eggs from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 Anita wants to purchase 30 trays of eggs for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase 30 trays of eggs for resale

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah is a single mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, and trays of eggs. She works at the market seven days a week. Her major business challenges includes thieves, defaulters and seasonality. She aspires to own a fully-stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more Irish potatoes, cooking oil, trays of eggs, and charcoal.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman and has six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwatime has operated a business of selling paraffin for use in cooking as retail to neighbors. She faces a challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan of 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to establish rental houses. She will use the loan to purchase cement and sand for the construction of the rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for the construction of rental houses.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, a youthful 49-year-old farmer from Motosiet, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his four children as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Joseph has always shown the resilience to beat all the odds.

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Joseph started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 10 years. Joseph's sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Joseph is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Joseph is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his grandchildren. Joseph's dream is to provide a secure future for his grandchildren through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.

With your help, Joseph will be able to pay for his children’s education, which is one of his biggest dreams!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en:
Lilian's Group is formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District and is being represented by Lilian, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married and has two children. Lilian has been a farmer for three years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Lilian isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Lilian will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Lilian's Group will purchase a total of five solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sucipto

texts.en:
Meet Sucipto, a micro-entrepreneur from Depok, Indonesia. Depok is a city located at the south border of Jakarta, the capital city.  Sucipto runs and manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and daily consumer products. He also sells mobile phone airtime credits and a utility bill payment service for his customers. Sucipto is married, and he and his wife have been blessed with one child. His wife is a full time housewife, and sometimes she helps Sucipto managing the stall. 

Sucipto joined Ruma about four months ago. He was excited to join because he sees many opportunities to improve his business by becoming a Ruma agent. By becoming a Ruma agent, he has been able to expand his network and learn new mobile technology. He also learned about a new product from Ruma, which is e-commerce for low income communities. Basically, his customers can buy stuff in the Ruma catalog by ordering through Sucipto, who will text a format order to Ruma. It’s another product from Ruma that Sucipto believes will give impact to customers who usually find it hard to get access to good-quality products with good prices. 

As the business runs, Sucipto is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Sucipto is standing in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Maria Melida

texts.es:
María, de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, se creció únicamente con su padre, ya que su madre murió cuando ella tenía 3 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, uno de ellos hace cuatro años vive en Estados Unidos de manera ilegal. 

María, se dedica a hacer y vender tortillas junto a su hija, tiene casi 17 años de vender este alimento, pues es la forma de llevar dinero al hogar, trabajan de lunes a sábado por las mañanas, ya es muy conocida por su negocio, pues tiene varios clientes en la comunidad.

Ella, solicita el crédito a Credicampo, para comprar varios quintales de maíz y leña, pues lo necesita para seguir con el negocio y poder seguir generando ingresos económicos para su alimentación  y la de su familia.- 
Además, quiere reparar la cocina artesanal donde coloca el comal para hacer las tortillas.

María, sueña con reunirse nuevamente con su hijo y poder construir una casa propia pues actualmente vive alquilando.
texts.en: María is 67 years old. She studied through third grade, and grew up only with her father because her mother died when she was 3 years old. She is a single mom with two children. One of her children has lived for the past 4 years in the United States illegally. Maria makes and sells tortillas with her daughter. She has been selling this product for the past 17 years, and this is the way that she makes money for her household. They work from Monday to Saturday in the mornings. She is well known for her business, and she has several clients in the community. She is asking for a loan from Credicampo to buy several quintals (a quintal is equivalent to 100 pounds) of corn and firewood which is needed to continue with her business and to keep generating income for her and her family. She also wants to repair her artisan stove, used to place the grill to make tortillas. Maria dreams to reunite again with her son and to build her own house because she is currently renting.

loans.use: To purchase several quintals (a quintal is equivalent to 100 pounds) of corn and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary home appliances for his house, such as a refrigerator and washing machine.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is 37 years old from Baniswef. He is married, has a three-year-old daughter, and he takes care of his aging and sick mother. 

Ashraf has a small grocery store project and it is the only source of income for his family. The lack of products in his store alienated his customers and consequently his income decreased. So he requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy more products such as rice, sugar and oil for his store.

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, sugar and oil for his store

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en: Amaal is 41 years old and from Baniswef. She is married with three schoolchildren. Her husband is a part-time farmer and they have a small grocery store project that she runs to help him with the family income. Amaal wishes to expand her project to increase the family income, so she requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator, juices and fizzy drinks.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, juices and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Vusal is a 47-year-old man. He is married and has a son and two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and takes care of their children. Vusal earns money for the family by raising and selling fruits and vegetables. His monthly earnings are only 150 AZN. He like gardening very much and became a gardener three years ago. Every day he gets more and more experience in this field. 

Vusal takes care of his harvest properly. Every day he looks after it, watering and feeding it with fertilizers. But he has a problem. He doesn't have a water tank in his yard, and has to supply it with water every week. This makes it expensive. He applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to install a water engine and water tank in his garden.

loans.use: to install a water engine and water tank in his garden

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 23-year-old single man. Ashraf  lives with his parents in the Imishli region. He is a very responsible and hardworking person. Though he is young, he provides for his family by himself because his father is so old and his mother is ill. He has been working in the sugar factory for three years. His work is hard but the salary is small so Ashraf cannot cover his family ‘s concerns. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

He dreams of seeing the construction of his house completed. It's for these reasons that Ashraf is applying for a loan of 1,200 AZN for the installation of potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house, for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: To have potable water in the kitchen, bathroom and laundry room of his house,

loans.name: Casur

texts.en:
Casur is a 30-year-old refugee. He is married and has three sons. The family lives in an IDP settlement in Bilasuvar. He is a farmer and raises crops and fruit trees. He is a hardworking man and does everything for his family. He has worked as a farmer for 10 years and has good skills, but his monthly income is 163 AZN. 

Casur wants to expand his small business and increase income, but his land for gardening and crops is very small. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy a piece of land and enlarge his harvest production.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land and enlarge his harvest production

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 28 years old and from Baniswef. He is a graduate of the faculty of commerce. He works as a salesperson in a clothing shop because he could not find a suitable job. His salary is very low and he can't save any money for his marriage. So he decided to quit the salesperson job and requested a 10,000 EGP loan to buy clothing to start his own clothing project.

loans.use: To buy clothing to start his own clothing project.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIEUX est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de savon.
Les femmes du groupe SERIEUX sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente N’GNA première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de mil. Elle compte acheter des sacs de mil sur place. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Fana à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Serieux ["Serious"] group is composed of married women averaging 44 years of age, with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They work as vendors selling cereals, condiments and soap. The group members are on their 24th solidarity loan. With the goal of meeting high customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. 

Our client N'gna, the first one standing from left to right in the photo, is illiterate. She currently works selling millet. She plans to buy bags of millet locally. She sells in Fana, retail, for cash, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly revenue of 80,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Eliyar

texts.en:
Eliyar is a 22-year-old married refugee. His wife is a houskeeper and they have a daughter and a son. The family is poor and the only income comes from gardening. Eliyar raises fruit trees and vegetables and sells them at the local bazaar.

Eliyar wakes up early in the morning and drives to the local bazaar in order to sell his harvest and earn money for his family. His monthly income from this is only 120 AZN. Eliyar's harvest was weak last year and the income was very low. He applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to supply quality fertilizers and recover the productivity of his garden. He wants to do everything in order to provide his family with a good life in such a hard period.

loans.use: to supply quality fertilizers and recover the productivity of his garden

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 45-year-old divorced mother of one child who has run her grocery store for five years. She is developing it gradually to keep it a good source of income in order to cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Mariam is acquiring her fourth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to develop and increase her accessories and perfumes section with newly-released special-offer products and to add winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of satisfying the needs of her only beloved child.

loans.use: to increase her accessories and perfumes section with newly-released special-offer products and add winter clothes

loans.name: Wisal

texts.en:
Wisal is a 29-year-old married mother of two children who has worked in a gift shop for two years and as a tutor to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved family.

Wisal's income and her husband's income are not enough anymore to satisfy the increasing living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a healthier and better place for her beloved kids.

Wisal hopes to open her own business in the future to increase her income and stay capable of improving her family's financial and living situations.

loans.use: to renovate her house to make it a healthier place for her beloved kids

loans.name: Mwanafusa

texts.en:
Mwanafusa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house which has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay her for goods purchased on credit. 

With this loan of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for farm transportation

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en: Philemon is only 29 years old. He lives in Koibatek village in the mountainous Kapsowar area of Kenya. He practices horticultural and dairy farming for a living. For the last two years, he has made a living selling crops and engaging in seasonal businesses. Philemon is seeking a loan to expand his farm. In order to scale up this business, he needs more land. With the loan, Philemon will use part of the money to rent land and the rest to pay for farm inputs and labour. This expansion will guarantee a better harvest for the young diligent farmer. Income from this investment will offset other farm-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Philemon replied, "Even though I am still single, the investment will put food on the table at least daily."

loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Leonisia Isabel

texts.es:
Leonisia, utilizó el préstamo anterior para hacer la adquisición de materiales para elaborar artesanías, sus ingresos están incrementando poco a poco, la familia tiene una vida más cómoda y todos se encuentran saludables.
Requiere de más capital para comprar pinturas y piezas de barro para decorar y luego vender, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para obtener los mejores beneficios de los créditos y poder tener más clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Leonisia used her previous loan for the acquisition of materials to make handicrafts. Her earnings are growing little by little, her family has a more comfortable life, and everyone is healthy.

She is requesting more capital to buy paints and pieces of clay, to decorate and then sell. Her goal is to keep working to obtain the greatest benefits from the loans and be able to have more satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy paints and pieces of clay, to decorate and then sell.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en: Patima is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Zugdidi district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow nut trees. In addition, they have a pig and a calf. Patima wants to expand her husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,250 GEL. With the received credit Patima will purchase a cow and will start producing dairy products. This will increase her family income, and with increased income she will be able to expand the business gradually.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Nurida

texts.en:
Nurida is a 52-year-old married woman. Her husband is a labourer and they have two beautiful daughters. The family are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Nurida is a farmer, and earns money for the family. She raises crops and fruit on a small piece of land. Currently she sells them to neighbours because she doesn't have a space at a local bazaar. 

Nurida works hard day and night. The total monthly income from selling her harvests is not more than 140 AZN, which is not enough for her family. Nurida has applied for a 800 AZN loan in order to buy a space at a local bazaar and sell her harvest there. This will increase her number of clients and her income a lot.

loans.use: to buy a space at a local bazaar and sell her harvest there

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
Saddam is a 23-year-old refugee. He is single and lives with parents in an IDP settlement build for refugees in Bilasuvar. He helps his parents by buying them medicines and taking care of them. He gets earnings raising and selling some fruits and vegetables in the backyard of their house. Additionally he keeps turkeys. He raises and fattens them and then sells them at a local bazaar. Unfortunately, the land is very small and Saddam has no place to keep turkeys. He has worked in this business for three years and his monthly income is only 110 AZN. 

Saddam loves his parents very much and does everything for them. He wants them to be healthy and live a happy life because it's very hard to be a refugee. Saddam applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to buy an additional small piece of land where he will be able to keep poultry. This will help him a lot. Let's support Saddam because he is a very hardworking and careful fellow.

loans.use: to buy an additional small piece of land and enlarge his harvest and income

loans.name: Souhaila

texts.en:
Souhaila is a 47-year-old married mother of five children. She started selling shoes a year ago to support her husband to cover the increasing needs and expenses of their beloved family.

Souhaila is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has a good reputation in her region. She is trying hard to develop her business, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable shoes and boots for this winter season. This will satisfy her customers' needs and requests.

Souhaila hopes to expand her business in the future, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new fashionable shoes and boots for this winter season

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Aniseh

texts.en: Aniseh is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and has two children, both of whom attend school. In 2012 she started her own business of producing homemade food. Aniseh is a farmer and uses her own harvests to produce her goods. She is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to invest in more lands and purchase seeds, as she seeks to increase her production, gaining a higher income. Despite all the challenges, Aniseh is very hard working and determined to change her future and that of her children by giving them a good education.

loans.use: to invest in more land and purchase seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying cosmetics and other products needed

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 34-year-old single woman living with one parent and two relatives. She sells clothes as a living and she states that she works really hard in cooperation with her relatives to earn a satisfactory revenue. She has been in this business since 2009.

Presently, Sajida seeks a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy the clothing needed as she wants to diversify her selection to attract more customers .

Sajida is positive that this loan will assist in enhancing her way of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing needed

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a third year student at the Central University College, she is pursuing a nursing degree. This loan will be used to help pay for her tuition fees. 

This profession interests her because she has the desire to save lives and bring comfort to people who are in need. The completion of her studies would allow her the opportunity to help her family and her community.

She will be pursuing her master’s degree in the next five or ten years, something she could not have achieved without education.

Her father inspires her to achieve her goals because of his humble beginnings. Without this loan, there would have been no other alternatives for her to further her education.

There are a lot of knowledgeable students in Ghana but due to financial constraints their skills are under developed, so she encourages investors to keep supporting such noble projects.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Mounifeh

texts.en:
Mounifeh is a 53-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. 

Her occupation consists of serving her customers with delicious bread produced at her domicile. Her goods are sold to multiple customers and marketers.

Today, Mounifeh wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy needed supplies and raw materials to continue her production properly. 

Mounifeh is a very positive person and always seeks the best for her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials to make bread.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et d’articles divers.
Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leurs vingt septième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente WASSA première personne de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’oignon, des sacs de sel, des cartons de cube Maggi et du grain d’arachide chez les grossistes à Fana. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is comprised of married women. On average, they are 42 years old and have four children. They live together in traditional families in the village of Warassala, which is in the Dioïla prefecture and the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell condiments and miscellaneous items. 

This is the 27th loan for the women of the Laidou group. With the goal of meeting the demands  of their clients, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso for support.

The client, Wassa, standing at left, is illiterate. She sells condiments. She would like to buy bags of onions, bags of salt, boxes of Maggi cube, and peanuts—all from the Fana wholesalers.

They sell for retail prices and for cash at the market to a mixed clientele. She would like to earn an average monthly income of 75,000 FCFA that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Yurielka Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres jóvenes mujeres dinámicas y emprendedoras (Karla Vanessa, Damaris del Socorro y Jhondra) de la etnia miskita que viven en Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas. Karla Vanesa tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende productos básicos, Damaris vende ropa nueva en un tramo que alquila en el mercado municipal y Jhondra es vendedora ambulante de productos de belleza. Las tres se han propuesto luchar para hacer crecer sus negocios, con el deseo de llegar a tener una mejor calidad de vida personal y de sus familias; se organizaron hace 8 meses para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. 

Karla Vanesa: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, casada, tiene  2 hijos: El mayor de 8 años estudia su 4to grado de primaria y un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos para su pulpería: Granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, huevo, pan, entre otros productos, así incrementar sus ingresos. Ella sueña con crecer más y contar con suficiente capital para ampliar y diversificar los productos del negocio.

Con el primer crédito recibido de Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, les permitió  a Jhondra incrementar los productos de belleza con lo cual estableció un pequeño salón de belleza donde atiende a sus clientes, ya dejo de ser vendedora ambulante, su ingreso ha ido mejorando porque ahora ha diversificado sus actividades.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three dynamic and enterprising young women:  Karla Vanesa, Damaris del Socorro, and Jhondra.  They are of Miskito ethnicity and live in Bilwi, Puerto Cabezas.  Karla Vanesa has a small store where she sells basic products.  Damaris sells new clothes from a rented stall at the municipal market.  Jhondra sells beauty products as a traveling saleswoman.  The three of them are determined to grow their businesses so that they and their families can have a better quality of life.  They organized as a group eight months ago so that they could access loans from Pana Pana that have a solidarity guarantee.  

Karla Vanesa is the coordinator of this solidarity group.  She is a friendly woman who has leadership qualities.  Karla is married and has two children.  Her older child is eight years old and is in the fourth grade of primary school.  The younger child is two years old.  Three years ago, she established a small grocery store where she generates her own income.  This enables her to contribute toward the household expenses and her child’s education.  Karla Vanesa is requesting a loan in order to buy more products for her store such as basic grains, yogurts, instant soups, toilet paper, eggs, bread, and other products so that she can increase her earnings.  She dreams of experiencing more growth and having sufficient capital to expand and diversify the inventory of products in her business.  

With the first loan issued by Pana Pana and financed through Kiva, Jhondra was able to increase her inventory of beauty products.  She established a small beauty salon where she attends to her customers, which means she quit being a traveling saleswoman.  Her income improved because her business activities are now diversified.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, yogurts, instant soups, toilet paper, eggs, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité se están esforzando por ir creciendo y mejorando cada día, cada una de ellas están haciendo un esfuerzo grande para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Lidia una de las integrantes se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías en cuero, es muy buena en lo que hace, es por ello que le va muy bien. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se esfuerza mucho por mejorar e ir creciendo sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuero, de manera a poder seguir creciendo y luchando en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this committee are striving to grow and improve each day. The members are making a huge effort to provide their families with everything they need so that they can live a decent life without deprivation.

Lidia is one of the members who makes leather handicrafts. She is very good at what she does and has been quite successful. Lidia is a hardworking and determined woman who does her best to improve and grow in her living conditions and to help her family.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of leather. This will enable her to keep growing and moving forward in her business.

loans.use: to buy leather for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, es una persona que se esta esforzando mucho para poder cumplir su meta de ser alguien en la vida. Ella esta luchando y se esfuerza mucho, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Luisa is studying for a degree in Business Administration. She is a person who is doing her best to accomplish her goal so that she can make something of her life. Luisa is striving and working hard. She says that her previous loan was used to pay her university fees, which was a great help.

Luisa is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees once again. This will help her to continue with her dream of becoming someone in life.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La población de este distrito se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz, realiza esta actividad desde hace 20 años contando con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será para la compra de semillas, abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, con esto Oswaldo espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le permitirá aumentar sus niveles de ingreso y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is 50 years old and lives with his wife. They reside in the District of Pucará in Jaén Province, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The people in this district engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture as their main business activities.

Oswaldo is in the business of growing corn. He has 20 years of experience in this type of work and he also has good personal and work-related references who are from the area. His loan will be used to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers so that he can maintain his corn crop. With this loan, Oswaldo hopes to offer a better quality product to his customers. This will help him to increase his income level and eventually improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers so that he can maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Ndanthe's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis octobre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité principale l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Penda qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée,est âgée de 50 ans et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons,le plus âgé a 35 ans et le plus petit a 12 ans.


Son activité principale est l'élevage ,elle achéte des brebis pour les élever et au bout de 08 à 10 mois les revends,aussi elle pratique une activité secondaire qui est l'achat de céréales.
