Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 04 moutons à 25000f l'unité,qu'elle revend au prix de 50000f l'unité et 05 sacs d'arachide à 10000f l'unité, qu'elle revend au prix de 15000f le sac.

Penda vise à renforcer son épargne,mais surtout subvenir aux besoins de sa famille tels que :la scolarité et la nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created in October 2009. Its members live in the same village and their main activities are livestock farming and small retail commerce.

Penda, who is raising her arm on the right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is a 50-year-old married mother of six children with four boys, the eldest of whom is 35 and the youngest 12 years old.


Her main activity is livestock farming. She buys sheep to raise and sells them after eight to ten months. She also has a secondary activity trading grain.

With the credit loan, she intends to buy four sheep at 25,000 francs each she will resell for 50,000 francs each; and five bags of groundnuts at 10,000 francs each, she will then resell at 15,000 francs a bag.

Penda aims to strengthen her savings, but mainly wants to meet her family's needs such as education and food.

loans.use: buy four sheep

loans.name: Maarietou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé depuis le cycle premier du banc  villageois et elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
La responsable madame Mariétou est une femme mariée âgée de 64 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 garçons et 5 filles.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de fruits saisonniers. Avec son nouveau crédit de 350000 elle se payer des paniers de fruits divers qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du marché de sa localité.
Le bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnel,de renforcer ses épargnes, de payer la scolarité de certains de ses enfants et de participer aux travaux de réfection de sa maison.
texts.en:
This group was established since the first round of the "banc villageois" loan association and are united through good social and professional relationships.

The group responsible is Mrs. Mariétou, a 64-year-old married mother of nine children, four boys and five girls.

She is an active retail merchant selling seasonal fruits. She will use her new 350,000 francs loan to buy various fruit baskets she will then retail at her local market.

The profits will enable her to meet her personal needs, strengthen her savings, pay school fees for some of her children, and participate in repairing her house.

loans.use: buy baskets of various fruits as income-generating activity

loans.name: Ndimbal Jaboot Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Ndimbal Jaboot regroupe des femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce de produits divers. Le GIE a été créé grâce à une tontine dans le quartier dans laquelle les membres du groupe appartiennent et viennent pour la première fois solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour un crédit qui leur permettra à chacune d’améliorer son activité.
La responsable, au milieu, habillé violet, s’appelle Fatim. Elle est âgée de la trentaine d’année, mariée et mère de famille, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre de l’habillement, des produits cosmétiques et des produits alimentaires. Grâce à ses recettes, elle arrive à régler ses besoins personnels.
Fatim veut développer son commerce, ouvrir un magasin où elle pourra vendre les différents produits au même endroit.
texts.en:
The Ndimbal Jaboot EIG (Economic Interest Group) brings together women who are active at trading various products. The EIG was created thanks to a neighborhood tontine (savings group) to which the group members belong.  For the first time they are seeking support from IMCEC for a credit loan that will enable each of them to improve their business.

The group responsible person is Fatim, sitting in the middle and dressed in purple. She is in her thirties, a married mother, and active in commerce for over 15 years. Her business consists of selling clothing, cosmetics and food products. With her profits, she manages to meet her personal needs.

Fatim wants to develop her business, open a store where she can sell different products in one location.

loans.use: buy cosmetics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es una señora casada, tiene 26 años de edad y 2 hijos de 1 y 6 años, el mayor asiste a la escuela, su esposo trabaja de chofer, Fernanda se dedica a la crianza de animales, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar vaconas para tenerlas en hierba por la que paga arriendo, la aspiración de esta señora es trabajar mucho y comprar una casita para que sus hijos tengan buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Fernanda is 26 years old and married. She has two children, ages six and one years old; the eldest is in school. Fernanda's husband is a driver. Fernanda makes a living raising animals. She will use this loan to buy heifers and look after them on the rented field she has. Fernanda aspires to work a lot and buy a small house in order to provide her children with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools and to hire labourers to help him with his work.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Carmina Sarah

texts.es:
Carmina es una mujer de 64 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de bisutería.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, sociable, comunicativa, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘Miraflores’ un área residencial caracterizada por su ubicación céntrica en la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura promedio de 4-21 grados centígrados, que varía durante el transcurso del día.
Carmina es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto crespo, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla y habla español porque vive en el centro de la ciudad. Su vida la realiza acompañada de su sobrina, viven en un departamento alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de bisutería como; aretes, pendientes, collares, pulseras, anillos, trabas, winchas, etc., material elaborado artesanalmente de plata 911. “anteriormente trabajaba como empleada, pero me independicé y ahora tengo mi propio negocio dónde yo me ocupo de mi tiempo…” comenta. Su sueño es que su sobrina sea profesional, ella desea realizar la compra de bisutería por mayor para aprovechar la demanda de temporada. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmina solicita un préstamo para la compra de bisutería por mayor para satisfacer la demanda de temporada.
texts.en:
Carmina is a 64-year-old single woman with no children, and she has a business selling jewelry.  She is entrepreneurial, independent, sociable, communicative, responsible, and hard-working.  She carries out her business in the residential area of Miraflores, which is characterized by its central location in the city and cold and dry climate with average temperatures between 4-21º C that vary throughout the day.  

Carmina has a dark complexion and short stature with short curly hair.  Her first language is Aymará, but she doesn't speak it now because she speaks Spanish as she lives in the city center.  She lives with her niece in a rented apartment made of bricks that has running water, electricity, and plumbing.  She is in the business of selling jewelry, such as stud and pendant earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, tie clips, and wristbands, among other things, which is handcrafted from 911 silver.  

She says that she was employed before but she became independent and now she has her own business where she is in charge of her own time.  Her dream is for her niece to become a professional.  Carmina is requesting a loan to take advantage of the demand this season and buy wholesale jewelry. This is her first sequence of loans from this institution in the year that she has been doing business.

loans.use: to buy wholesale jewelry to satisfy the demand this season

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en: Nawale is a forty-nine-year-old married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. Three years ago, she started to work from her home as a food producer. Her products are well-enjoyed by customers. And now, Nawale wants to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase foodstuffs, as she wants to increase her productivity as well as her income. In the future, Nawale hopes to make her business much bigger and might open a store where she will better demonstrate her products.

loans.use: purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Thúy is thirty-one years old and she is married with two children.She live s and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thúy  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Thúy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Thúy Nguyễn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: a thermal display counter, chicken, meat, fish, rice, tomatoes, etc .

loans.name: Francisca Yamileth

texts.es:
Francisca, ha administrado de buena manera el crédito anterior por lo que manifiesta que la tortillería está creciendo, ha tenido que contratar a una persona para que le ayude a cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, también ha comprado electrodomésticos para el hogar y ya puede costear el transporte privado para que su hija viaje a la escuela y regrese a casa con mayor seguridad.
Con el propósito de seguir mejorando requiere de un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar maíz, leña, cal, bolsas y gas propano, adquirirá la materia prima suficiente para elaborar la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Francisca successfully managed her previous loan and as a result her tortilla store is growing. She has been able to hire one person to help her meet the needs of her customers and has also bought some appliances for her home as well as now being able to afford private transport to make her daughter's journey to and from school much safer.

With the intention of continuing to improve, this new loan will be used for buying flour, wood, lime, bags and propane gas; enough raw materials to keep making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: buy flour, wood, lime, bags and propane gas - enough raw materials to keep making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Corina

texts.en: Corina is 41 years old and she sells spare parts in a store where she pays rent. Corina has her own house but the place needs to be finished. Corina wants a loan to buy more spare parts. In the future Corina wants to finish the construction of her house. Also Corina is the mother of three children that she loves a lot so she will do anything to help them. Corina is married and her husband helps her selling the spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
Eloy is 26 years old. He is married and he and his wife have a 3-year-old son. Eloy is the only one in the family who makes money. 

He is a taxi driver and he works in the city of La Paz. Eloy works for a taxi company but he is the owner of the car he drives. 

Eloy had an accident and the car needs repairs. He needs a loan to pay for repairs. Eloy hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Barnohol

texts.ru: Her name is Barnohol. She with family lives in the area Shahritus. She has a big family. She is 61 years old. Barnohol is married and has six children. Her eldest son is married and has children and lives with her. Barnohol engaged in the district animal husbandry. She has a barn, where she engaged in animal husbandry. Barnohol in 15 years of her life engaged in this activity. She is an experienced and responsible woman at work. Husband and sons helps to her. Her husband and eldest son is engaged in agriculture in the district to ensure the living conditions of the family. Barnohol takes credit, because she has a small number of cattle.  She wants keep activities and increases the number of livestock. This loan will help her get some young calves and expand. Barnohol looks forward to your support in advance and she is grateful.
texts.en: Her name is Barnohol. She lives with her family in the area of Shahrituz. She has a big family. Barnohol is married and has six children. She is 61 years old. Her eldest son is married, has children and lives with her. Barnohol is engaged in the business of animal husbandry and has a barn. Barnohol has been in this business for fifteen years. She is an experienced and responsible woman. Her husband and sons are helping her. Her husband and eldest son are involved in agriculture to improve the living conditions of the family. Barnohol is taking out the loan because she has a small headcount of cattle.  She wants to grow business and increases the number of livestock. This loan will help her get some young calves and expand. Barnohol looks forward to your support and is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to buy young calves.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида, 29 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Саида занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Саиды на сегодняшний день имеется 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Саиды составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка скота. Доходы от кредита Саида планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также планирует купить мебель для дома.
texts.en: Saida is 29 years old, she is married and is a mother of three children. Saida does animal husbandry. Because of her hard work Saida now has twenty sheep in her business. Her monthly income is about 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal to further grow her business she has come to the bank Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy livestock. Saida plans to invest the income from the loan into further growth of her business and also plans to buy furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Dieuseul

texts.en:
Dieuseul has embraced the need for environmental protection since he was a child, growing up in a family where this type of business is done. He has started growing his own species of flowers in his mother's backyard. 

Today he has a company named Haiti Plantation. It is one of the rare enterprises in Haiti that takes a leading role in helping Haiti reduce the impact of climate change. The business has prioritized the protection of the Haitian environment by promoting local greenhouse production. For 15 years the business has been taking care of the three principal forces that govern this sector, which are cost of production, quality and cost of transportation. 

Your contribution will help Dieuseul buy more flowers and make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase 25 flowering plants to resell for indoor gardening, funerals, and weddings.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.en:
Gonzalo is 49 years old. He is married and he has two sons. Gonzalo has his own house, where his family lives comfortably. 

Gonzalo is still making women's shoes and now he has two employees working for him. He needs another loan to buy leather and faux leather for his shoe-making work. Gonzalo wants to make men's shoes too and he dreams of having his own store one day

loans.use: to buy leather and faux leather for his shoe-making work.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.en:
Joaquin is 46 years old and he has his own house. Joaquin is divorced and he lives with his son. 

Joaquin makes money by giving a shower service. He has some showers installed at his house and he rents them to many customers.

Joaquin needs a loan to fix his showers. He wants to install a swimming pool and a sauna in the future. He hopes you can help him. 

In the picture, Joaquin appears in the place where his customers take a shower.

loans.use: to fix his showers.

loans.name: Narasco

texts.en:
Narasco, who is in his late 20’s, is single. He has been selling secondhand shoes since 2012. He works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Narasco's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the secondhand stock and can now sell to many customers. He used the profits to take care of himself and covered household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy the updated styles to meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of starting agriculture and planting onions. 

Narasco will make sure that he repays his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy the updated styles to meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young fish and expand fish farming.

loans.name: Muong Phang 20 Group

texts.en:
Tien, 27, is a Thai lady who is married and has a son, age 10. She lives with her husband and her son in a Thai traditional house in a remote area and works at agricultural production for a living. Indeed, Tien is a hard-working farmer and she has constantly expanded and diversified activities in cultivation and animal husbandry, such as cultivating rice, raising pigs, chickens, ducks and buffalo. 

To have enough capital for investment, Tien has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use the loan to buy piglets and expand breeding pigs. Despite plenty of difficulties and instabilities ahead in agricultural production, she believes that with the support of the Anh Chi Em Program's socio-economic team, she can overcome the difficult situations. 

She hopes her investment will go smoothly and help her significantly improve income for her family. She dreams her children will soon escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and expand breeding pigs.

loans.name: Mesiya  B Group

texts.en:
Jonas, who is in his mid '40s, is married and has three children, two of whom are still in school while the other one is grown. He has been running a food shop for nine years now.  He works from 6:30 to 11:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jonas's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses.  

He will use this loan to open a shop with the same items in a different place. He dreams of owning a wholesale and retail shop.

Jonas will share this loan with his loan group, "Mesiya B," which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a shop with the same items in a different place.

loans.name: Victor Nii

texts.en:
“I am Victor and a final year student at the Central University College, pursuing a course in Marketing. The loan is to help pay for my tuition fees.

"My country manager inspires me; the reason being that you should not be complacent at where you are now and that there is more to be achieved.

"Marketing is one of the most important departments of a firm and as such the passion to introduce products and create awareness about a particular thing is what I like doing. Definitely after completion it will boost my chances on earning a higher pay and a more respectable position and this goes a long way to help my family.

"I see myself becoming a chief marketing officer at one of the multinational companies in the country in the near future. I would also continue on with my second degree.

"But for this loan, my education would have been affected badly because I have no other source of help.

“Ghana has a lot of investment opportunities since we basked in natural resources. It is a peaceful country where other nationals are not discriminated, making it the gateway to West Africa”, he says.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from a general store.  Ofelia has been in this business for 33 years. 

Ofelia requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 54 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Meriam has been farming rice  for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables and raising pigs.


Meriam is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.


She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angie works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Angie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 53 years old and married. Adelita works very hard to provide for her family.

Adelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Adelita has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Adelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jeancy

texts.en:
Jeancy is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jeancy works very hard to provide for them.

Jeancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, etc.

Jeancy has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Jeancy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 58 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Rosalina has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from fishing.  Rosalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 55 years old and married with nine children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

Dolores has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Dolores aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Melani

texts.en:
Melani is 41 years old with three children. With three children in school, Melani works very hard to provide for them.

Melani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, etc..

Melani has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, candies, junk foods, etc. 

In the future, Melani would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.en: Fabiola is 29 years old and lives with her partner and 3 small children in her grandfather's home. She works as a house cleaner and babysitter.  Fabiola is asking for a loan for home improvements to provide a better space for her family. She considers herself credit worthy and says that in the past she has taken some loans and always repaid them on time.

loans.use: To complete home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay workers to look after her potato crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children attending school. She has worked since 2005 as a tailor, and she is specialized in manufacturing curtains. She is talented at her job and creates special designs that satisfy her customers' demands. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase textiles and start a new business, which is producing dresses. Ghada is currently enlarging her business, hoping that it will be much more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase textiles

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and married with four children.

Maria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

Maria has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Kisa Kya Mukama Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is a group member of Kisa Kya Mukama Nakivubo group. He is aged 30 years and married with two children, aged 6 and 4 years respectively.
 
He sells clothes at Nakivubo Kisenyi. He has been in this business for the last four years; it supports the family, thus meeting the family's needs.

He has a long-term plan of expanding the business; thus, he applied for the loan to purchase stock in order to meet his clients' needs and become competitive. However, he faces the challenge of competition from the other shops, which he will soon beat with the continuous financial boost. 

The group is committed to achieving their goals. The sixth person at the extreme left is the UGAFODE credit officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Amni Lili

texts.es: Amni, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casada, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Yoro. Ella tiene 4 años de haber decidido tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa para niños y jóvenes como ser camisas, pantalones, camisetas, vestidos y también vende calzado. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante ofreciendo  sus productos en la aldea.  Esta actividad la ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 8,000 lempiras para comprar mas mercadería en ropa variada como ser camisetas, blusas, vestidos, pantalones para niños y jovenes, para aumentar su inventario  y aumentar las ventas. Su objetivo de tener más ingresos  es para darle el estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Amni is 29 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in a village in the municipality of Yoro. It has been 4 years since she decided to have her own business selling clothing for children and youth like shirts, pants, t-shirts, dresses and she also sells footwear. She does this business itinerantly offering her products in her community.

She has kept her business running with a number of loans. Currently she is requesting 8,000 HNL to buy a variety of more merchandise like t-shirts, blouses, dresses and pants for children and youth to increase her inventory and sales. Her objective is to have more income so she can provide education for her son.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses, dresses and pants for children and youth to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar leña, insumos para la tienda de consumo, cilindros de gas propano y dos estantes, ofrecerá la mercadería que demandan sus clientes, fortalecer el nuevo rubro como lo es la venta de tortillas y podrá dar cambiar la imagen del negocio, espera tener buenos resultados con la nueva inversión. 
El crédito anterior le ha sido de ayuda para ofrecer a sus clientes golosinas, granos básicos, diferentes bebidas, etc., las ganancias las utiliza para brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia, cubrir el pago de sus deudas e iniciar a vender tortillas para tener ingresos mayores.
texts.en:
Rosa has decided to ask for a new loan to purchase wood, other inputs for her store, cylinders of propane gas, and two shelves. This will enable her to offer the merchandise that her customers are demanding, to strengthen her new work in tortilla sales, and be able to improve the image of the business. She expects to have good results with the new investment.

The previous loan has been helpful to offer her customers sweets, basic grains, different beverages, etc. The earnings have been used to provide a better life for her family, to cover the payment of her debts, and invest in tortilla sales business to have increased income.

loans.use: to buy wood, inputs for her store, cylinders of propane gas, and two shelves, in order to offer her customers the merchandise they demand.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vivian is 40 years old, and two children are in school.

Vivian has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Vivian requested an 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Vivian has been in this business for four years. In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre de 27 años de edad vive felizmente junto  a su familia en una comunidad de Sololá. 
Alfredo es un señor que se dedica a la agricultura, es un trabajo que le gusta hacer ya que lo ha venido desempeñando desde pequeño, pues antes de adquirir prestamo con ADICLA sembrado poco porque no contaba con suficiente capital de trabajo, ahora con el primer prestamo  ha mejorado su vida y también sus ingresos. Alfredo manifiesta que los préstamos son medios de superación en la vida y con las ganancias se logra otras metas. 

Pues Alfredo a raíz de los resultados en el primer prestamo decide someterse en busca de otro para seguir ampliando y mejorando sus cultivos, él ahora necesita  un prestamo de  tres mil quetzales para sembrar seis cuerdas de papa, compra de fertilizantes  y otros  insumos. Pues la idea de Alfredo es conseguir el prestamo para poder dejar comprado todo lo necesario y cuando es necesario la aplicación todo lo tiene a su alcance.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a 27 year old man who lives happily with his family in a community of Sololá. Alfredo is a man who works in agriculture. It is work that he likes to do as he has been doing it since he was small.

But before he got a loan from ADICLA he planted little as he didn't have enough working capital. Now the first loan has improved his life and his income. Alfredo says that the loans are means to excel in life and with the profits he can achieve other goals. So on the basis of the results of the first loan decided to undergo looking for another to continue to expand and improve his crops. He now needs a loan of 3,000 GTQ to plant 6 cuerdas (about 6 acres) of potatoes, buy fertilizer and other inputs. Alfredo's idea is to get a loan to be able to buy everything needed and apply it when it is needed as he will have it all at hand.

loans.use: to plants potatoes, buying fertilizer and inputs.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is a student at the University of Education Winneba, and is pursuing a diploma in early childhood education. The loan facility is to help pay for his tuition fees.

He has interest in his chosen career because as a teacher, he is always learning new ideas and it also comes with the joy of knowing that he is impacting the lives of a younger generation positively.

Furthering his education would boost his chances of acquiring higher, new and innovative skills in his career as a teacher.

Some of his friends inspire him a lot to reach his goals in life because of the positions they hold in their places of work considering their humble beginnings.

The loan facility has really come in handy because "I had no other alternative to pay my fees than to defer the course, something I couldn’t have afforded to do. My people are hardworking, but need a lot of support to further their education and also to start up their own business.”

loans.use: to pay his fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Xiengban Group

texts.en:
Sangvan’s village sources much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Sangvan and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets as treating drinking water requires cash and time. He and his group members are excited that a water filter is available on an affordable payment plan. This filter is guaranteed for two years.

Sangvan will use his portion of his group loan to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water. His purchase will allow him to shift his resources to other pursuits. Over the next two years, Sangvan and his family will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter to have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs; oil, sugar, rice, to resell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 52 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. For the past 20 years, she has been a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. Wilma is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilma is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Siria Marveli

texts.es:
Siria, es sastre, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de su familia y a perfeccionado sus conocimientos mediante cursos de costura, la sastrería fue fundada hace 5 años, tiene un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., vive con sus hijos y no tiene ayuda del extranjero.
El crédito le ayudara a realizar la compra de telas, hilos, botones, agujas, aplicaciones, entre otros materiales necesarios para elaborar las prendas de vestir, espera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
Sus sueños son instalar un bazar con mercadería exclusiva para la sastrería, cancelar la deuda y ganar nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Siria is a dressmaker who learned the trade with the help of her family and she perfected her knowledge through sewing courses. She established her sewing shop 5 years ago and her timetable is from 7 am until 5 pm. She lives with her children and gets no help from abroad.

The loan will help her make the purchase of fabric, thread , buttons, needles, adornments amongst other materials needed to make her clothing. She hopes to increase her income and improve her service to her customers. Her dream is to open a store with exclusive merchandise for sewing, pay off her loan and make new clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, adornments, amongst other materials needed to make her clothing.

loans.name: Priscila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Priscila, ha tenido cambios positivos en su vida familiar, su nivel de endeudamiento es más bajo, la cosecha de maíz es mayor y mantiene con vida la venta de tamales y antojitos, estos resultados son por la inversión y buena administración del crédito anterior.
En la actualidad tiene mayores demandas, por lo que ha decido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar harina, carnes, gallinas indias, verduras, aceite, sal, condimentos, etc. para elaborar la venta de tamales y antojitos, espera mantener sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Priscila has seen positive changes in her family life, her level of debt is very low, her corn harvest is good and she makes a living by selling tamales and snacks, all of which are a direct result of the good management of a previous loan.

She is currently experiencing an increase in demand and so she has decided to ask for a new loan to purchase flour, meat, chicken, vegetables, oil, salt, condiments etc in order to make tamales and other snacks so she can continue to have satisfied customers.

loans.use: purchase flour, meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments and more to make tamales.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto, necesita capital y como siente que la institución lo apoya cuando él lo requiere, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para invertir en leña, arcilla, loza cruda, nacazcol y barro, seguirá produciendo artesanías y cubriendo los pedidos de sus clientes.
Con ayuda del capital anterior Heriberto ha tenido materiales para que su negocio de elaboración y venta de artesanías de barro siga siendo una fuente de ingresos familiar,  entre sus beneficios están nuevos clientes, mejores ingresos y tanto él como su familia se encuentran gozando de buena salud.
texts.en:
Heriberto needs investment capital and because his communal bank supports him when he needs it, he has decided to ask for a new loan so he can invest in firewood, clay, ceramics, sand, and mud so he can continue to product his artisan crafts and meet customer demand.

With the help of a previous loan, Heriberto had enough materials to make and sell enough ceramics for this to be a source of income for his family. And his has new customers, a better income and he and his family are enjoying good health.

loans.use: purchase firewood, clay, ceramics etc. to make artisanal products

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
Petronila, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de  hamacas, tiene 10 hijos, de los diez solo tienen dos que dependen económicamente de ella, los de más ya formaron sus propias familias.

Petronila, se dedica a la venta de alimentos típicos como yuca, pastelito de carne, enchiladas, tostada de plátano etc. Se ha dedica a este negocio por más de 15 años, el negocio lo aprendió ella sola.- El negocio lo tiene en su casa, ya que enfrente está el centro escolar del caserío y los alumnos le compran bastante.

Petronila, con el crédito comprará yuca, carne, harina, plátanos, entre otros productos para la elaboración de los típicos, también comprará pollos de engorde y cerdos. 

Los sueños de Petronila es, que su negocio crezca más y le genere más ganancias, para la sostenibilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Petronila is 56 years old. She studied up to first grade, she is married and her husband makes a living making and selling hammocks. She has 10 children, only two of them are still economically dependent, the rest already formed their own families.

Petronila works selling typical local food, such as yucca, meat pastries, enchiladas, plantain chips, etc. She was self-taught and has made a living with this occupation for more than 15 years. Her business is inside her house, since the school is right across the street and the students buy quite a lot from her.

With this loan, Petronila will buy yucca, meat, flour and plantain among other ingredients to make these typical foods. She will also buy chickens for fattening and pigs.

Her dream is for her business to grow and generate more profit so that she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy yucca, meat, flour and plantain among other products to prepare typical dishes.

loans.name: Canelitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CANELITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de ropa americana, tienda de carnicería, venta de comida, venta de mantas de vicuña, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefa es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio trenzado de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, a quien ayudaba desde niña, es por ello que decide implementar un negocio independiente ya que conocía la forma de trenzado. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flecos e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a solicitud del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CANELITAS" began its first cyle with Pro Mujer as part of the" Centro Focal de German Busch". It is a group made up of 8 people and is headed by the President, Josefa. The businesses the members run in this collective range from selling vegetables to selling American style clothing to running a butcher's shop to selling blankets made from the wool of the vicuña (related to llamas), to selling coats.

The loan will help a micro-business that Josefa runs. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for 7 years and was invited to join by a friend who was already a client of the institution. Curently, Josefa has a business making blankets. She learned his trade from her mother, who she helped since she was a little girl. And so, she decided to open her own business since she was already skilled in this craft.

The loan she is asking for today will be used to purchase tassels and thread on wholesale that she will purchase from larger sellers in La Paz. She will then use the materials to make her blankets. This work helps her generate enough income to support her family. She is married and has three children.

When asked about Pro Mujer, she said she liked the institution and that she enjoyed the seminars on health that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase tassels and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chayotes, papayas, strawberries, grapes, watermelons, tomatoes, etc. She will stock her business with fresh merchandise when necessary to do so.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lestari

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Lestari, a Ruma agent who lives in Depok. Depok is a city located at the south of Jakarta, the capital city. Lestari is happily married, and she and her husband have been blessed with three sons.  Her husband works as a private driver. 

To support family’s needs, Lestari and her husband decided to open a small stall which sells mobile phone sim cards, mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment service. Lestari manages it day-to-day while her husband works as a driver. 

Lestari joined Ruma about four months ago, as a result of a visit to her stall from a Ruma agent. She was interested to join Ruma because she wanted to expand her network and learn how to improve her business. 

As the business runs, Lestari is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the photo, Lestari is standing in front of her stall, which is where her customers usually come to buy mobile airtime or pay their bills. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Bunheng

texts.en:
Bunheng is a 21-year-old student who is from the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. He majors in English literature at an institute and is in his first year. His father is a rice farmer and also a motorcycle taxi driver. His mother earns some income from making clay pots and water containers to sell. 

Bunheng doesn’t have enough finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, so now he is applying for a loan. This loan will help him graduate and earn knowledge for his future job. For his dream after graduation, he wants to be an English teacher with a decent salary to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get treatment

loans.name: Aissatou Saly's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis le 07 octobres 2009.Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et sont solidairement liés par une responsabilité pour le remboursement de leur crédit et elles pratiquent comme activité principale le commerce.

Aissatou qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est veuve et mére de 07 enfants dont 05 garçons.


Son activité est le commerce de mil et de l'arachide,elle a une bonne expérience pour ce type d'activité.Elle s'approvisionne dans son village pour aller revendre dans les villages environnants.

Elle compte acheter avec son crédit:10 sacs d'arachide à 10000f le sac puis le revendre à 15000f et 20 sacs de mil à 5000f l'unité qu'elle revend à 6500f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et d'assurer la nourriture et l'achat des médicaments de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on the 7 October 2009.  It brings together women who live in the same village and who are united by the responsibility for repaying their loan. Their main activity is commerce. 

Aissatou, who is on the right of the photo, raising her hand, is in charge of the group.  She is a widow and mother of 7 children, of whom 5 are boys. 

Her business is selling millet and peanuts and she has good experience in this business.  She stocks up in her village in order to go and sell in the local villages.  

With her loan she expects to buy: 10 sacks of peanuts at 1000f per sack and then resell them at 15000F and 20 sacks of millet at 5000f each which she will resell at 6500f.  Her objective is to increase her savings and afford food and the purchase of medicines for her family.

loans.use: to buy millet and peanuts

loans.name: Abdi

texts.en:
Meet Abdi, a micro-entrepreneur from Depok, Indonesia. Depok is a city located at the south border of Jakarta, the capital city. 
Abdi runs and manages a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and daily consumer products. He also sells mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment services for his customers.  Abdi is married, and he and his wife have been blessed with one son and one daughter. His wife is a full time housewife, and sometimes she helps Abdi to manage the stall. 

Abdi has been a member of Ruma for more than a year. He was excited to join because he sees many opportunities to improve his business by becoming a Ruma agent. By becoming a Ruma agent, he has been able to expand his network and learn new mobile technology. He also learned about a new product from Ruma, which is an e-commerce product for low-income communities. Basically, his customers can buy stuff in the Ruma catalog by ordering from Abdi, and Abdi will text a format order to Ruma. It’s another product from Ruma that Abdi believes will help customers who usually find it hard to get access to good-quality products with good prices. 

As the business runs, Abdi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Abdi is standing in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Manas

texts.ru: Манас, 27 лет, женат, детей нет. У Манаса средне-специальное образование, уже 5 лет он занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Манаса на сегодняшний день есть: 3 дойные коровы и 2 бычка, 12 коз, а также 2,5 ГА поливной земли. Ежемесячная прибыль от ведения бизнеса около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Манас обратился в Банк "Бай Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Доходы от бизнеса помогут Манасу развить его бизнес, а также накопить средства на покупку земельного участия.
texts.en:
Manas is 27 and married with no children. He has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for five years. He currently has three dairy cows, two steers and 12 goats on his farm as well as 2.5 hectares of cultivated land. His monthly business income is about 10,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing his business, Manas has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase 2 steers. Profits from the loan will allow him to develop his business and to save toward buying more land.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Marialyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marialyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Marialyn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Marialyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods

loans.name: Cheryl Joy

texts.en:
Cheryl Joy, at the aged of 25, owns a rice field and makes it a business of rice production. She's married with two children. Her husband also helps their living by driving a motorcycle.  

She needs financial assistance to have more production from her rice farm.  Recently she took a loan to buy organic fertilizer.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón es comerciante y tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas en un lugar estratégico, y comenta que es por ello que le va muy bien.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo para poder mejorar su trabajo e ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo vine haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón is a merchant who has a business of selling beverages from a strategic location. He says that he is doing very well because of this.

Ramón is a hardworking individual who is striving to grow and move forward. His goal is to keep growing so that he can improve his work and his earnings.

He is requesting this loan so that he can buy various beverages. This will help him to continue his sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy various beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nilie

texts.en:
Nilie works hard to support her family. Nilie is married, and has a buy and sell firewood and charcoal business in the Philippines. Nilie has been in this business for 26 years now.

Nilie requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of firewood and sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Nilie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Ana, a Ruma agent who has beenwith Ruma for more than a year. This is the second time that Ana is applying for a Kiva loan. The first Kiva loan had helped her business to improve so much more that Ana is now able to add one more service in her stall.

Ana and her husband live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Her husband works as a staff in a local company. As a young married couple, Ana and her husband want to be prepared for their family. One day they will have children, and they need to improve their business to save more extra income. 

Ana and her husband are very determined people; they work hard and they have been persistent in what they do. Ana has a small stall that sells groceries, daily consumer goods, also snacks and drinks. She also sells mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payments service for her customers. 

For the last 4 months, Ana has been selling new product from Ruma, which is e-commerce for the low income community, called ‘Mapan’. With Mapan, Ana is able to connect people in her community to many good quality products with better prices. 

As the business runs, Ana is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. 

In the photo, Ana and her husband are standing in front of her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
As a married parent of 14 children, Eva works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Eva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Delma works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Delma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

Delma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals like ducks, guinea pigs, and chickens, and to purchase balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Normita

texts.en: Normita is a hardworking mother who has owned and managed a small retail store for almost fifteen years. She is 54 years old and has three children. She aspires to improve her business and increase her income but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to request a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, soft drinks and some vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will receive this loan so that she can further improve her business and sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, rice, soft drinks and some vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maristela is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Maristela has been in pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita works hard to support her family. Mercedita is widowed and has a video-gaming-machine rental business in the Philippines.

Mercedita requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merlina is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Merlina has a rug-making business in the Philippines. Merlina requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Merlina has been in this business for six years. Merlina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Ma. Delia is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Delia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Delia has been in pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou is a 40-year-old married mother of three children in her care. She resides in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. To earn a living to support her family, she cultivates rice and also makes clay pots to sell. She has been in this line of work since 1999. Her husband is a 49-year-old rice farmer and he also has a motorcycle to run a taxi service. All of her children are in school.  

Peou and her husband can make an income of 8 USD a day. Now she is lacking the finances to buy more clay and firewood to make clay pots to sell, so she would like a loan. With the loan, she will be able to earn more income to support her family. Regarding her future plans, she is going to expand her rice farm and buy piglets to fatten. She also wants to support her children to go through high school, and if possible, to go to university.

loans.use: to buy more clay and wood to make clay pots  to sell

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is 56 years old, married and has five children. He is a farmer and acquires income through planting and harvesting rice to sell. He is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. With enough farm inputs, he will be able to have a good harvest. Someday, he hopes to harvest crops abundantly. His profits will be allotted for education and revolving capital in his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Valientes forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una de estas mujeres están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer e ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder crecer y salir adelante es la Sra. Gabriela, quien tiene un negocio de ropería y artículos de bazar, y gracias a la gran variedad que tiene da a sus clientes lo que buscan. Ella esta agradecida ya que gracias a las capacitaciones que reciben y con los seguimientos, están mejorando su calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, y artículos de bazar, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y luchando por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group named “Mujeres Valientes” (Valiant Women) is participating in the poverty elimination program. All of the members are giving their best effort so that they can grow and overcome their poverty situation.

One of the members who is working hard to grow and move forward is Sra. Gabriela. She has a clothing store and bazaar as her business. Gabriela offers a wide variety of products that her customers are looking for. She is grateful for the training and monitoring that she has received since these have helped her to improve her quality of life.

Gabriela is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes and bazaar products so that she can continue her sales. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can continue to grow and strive to improve each day.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes and bazaar products to sell.

loans.name: Felista

texts.es:
Felista tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su población se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería como actividades económicas principales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos y aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, tiene clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella, su esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos en los restaurantes de la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de chivos y aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Felista espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos e incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felista is 54 years old and married. She lives with her husband in the District of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, which is in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The residents engage in trade, agriculture, and livestock breeding as their main business activities.

Felista raises and sells goats and poultry such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and other livestock. She has established customers who have provided good personal and work-related references on her behalf. Her husband sells shellfish to restaurants in the area.

Felista is requesting a loan in order to buy a large quantity of goats and poultry such as ducks, turkeys, and other birds. In addition, she will buy balanced feed for fattening the animals. With this loan, Felista hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to her customers. This will have a great impact on her income level and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy goats, poultry, and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosette Mae is 18 years old and is third of three children in the family. Her mother, Rosalia, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her livestock-raising business in the Philippines.

Rosette Mae is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Hotel Management and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course.

Rosalia is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay tuition fees for her daughter Rosette Mae for the second semester of the school year 2014-15.

Rosette Mae plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 55-year-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 31 years old and married with one child in school. Analie works very hard to provide for them.

Analie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Analie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Analie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aileen is 33 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Aileen has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Aileen has been in this business for two years. Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 50 years old and is a married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Araceli has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines. Araceli requested a 19,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell.

Araceli has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita works hard to support her family. Tita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Tita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Tita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ann Virlyn

texts.en:
Ann Virlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ann Virlyn is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ann Virlyn has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Ann Virlyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

Ann Virlyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ann Virlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Emely runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, juice, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. to sell.

Emely has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Emely aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, juice, sanitary pads, bath soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenaida is 41 years old.

Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for two years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, tiene como actividad económica el cultivo de granos básicos y elaboración de pan, es así como tiene recursos económicos para costear los gastos de su familia, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y trabaja todos los días, la familia de Juan está integrada por su esposa de 39 años de edad y un hijo de 20 años de edad, toda la familia trabaja junta.
Invertirá en harina, manteca, aceite, levadura, latas, azúcar, sal y otros materiales con los que elaborará el pan para vender, fortalecerá la panadería para incrementar su producción y calidad del producto, espera atraer nuevos clientes, que sus demandas sean mayores y tener ingresos estables para el pago de sus deudas.
Su sueño es brindar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Juan makes a living by growing basic grains and baking bread. He has 8 years of experience and he works every day. This business is sufficient to cover the household needs of his family. He has a wife who is 39 years old, a son who is 20, and the whole family works together.

He will invest the loan in purchasing flour, lard, oil, yeast, dairy, sugar, salt and other materials he needs to bake bread. Stocking up on these materials will make his business stronger, increase his production, as well as improve the quality of his product, and hopefully attract new customers. Demand is growing and his income is stable and he is able to pay his debts.

His dream is to provide his family with better food, clothing and health.

loans.use: purchase flour, lard, oil, yeast, dairy products, sugar, salt and more.

loans.name: Roxana Yaneth

texts.es:
Roxana, está solicitando más capital de trabajo para comprar papel fotográfico, un scanner y bolsas  (para fortalecer la venta de hielo), seguirá dando un buen servicio en su foto estudio y teniendo ingresos para subsistir.
Con el préstamo anterior logro equipar su negocio con materiales que han sido de ayuda para cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes en ese momento, su estilo de vida familiar está evolucionando favorablemente  y por el momento no representan dificultades para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Roxana is in need of investment capital so she can purchase photo-printing paper, a scanner and bags (to use in her ice-selling business). This will help her to continue to offer quality service at her photo studio and to increase her income.

With her previous loan, she was able to outfit her business with materials she needed in order to meet customer demand. Her lifestyle is evolving for the better and at the moment she has not difficulties that would prevent her from working.

loans.use: purchase photo-printer paper, a scanner and bags.

loans.name: Cris Ann

texts.en:
Cris Ann is single and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase utensils and spices for her restaurant.

She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Cris Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and spices for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and potato seeds.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Divinas de 18 integrantes está en el ciclo numero 6 del programa de Comité de Mujeres, todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza como un medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Yolanda se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y a la elaboración de comidas, y comenta que su marido se dedica a la venta de pescado es con esto que se ayudan mutuamente para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener. Es una mujer muy emprendedora al igual que su marido, ella sueña con poder crecer e ir mejorando cada día.
La Sra. Yolanda  solicita  este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para la elaboración de comidas, y también para la compra de frutas y verduras. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group named “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) includes 18 members who are participating in their sixth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. They are have also taken the poverty elimination survey, which will help them to improve their living conditions.

Sra. Yolanda sells fruits and vegetables, but she also prepares food. She says that her husband sells fish and that they work together to provide their family with everything that they were not able to have. Yolanda is a woman who is very enterprising, as well as her husband. She dreams of growing and improving each day.

Yolanda is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for preparing her dishes. She will also buy fruits and vegetables. Yolanda appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can grow and move forward.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for preparing her dishes and to acquire fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 57 years old, married and has four children. She's been in the hog-raising business for 10 years, with the help of her husband. She earns a stable income from the hog-raising business that has helped her to sustain the needs of her family over this time. Rosita joined GDMPC in 2010, and became a member. She needs financial assistance to purchase feeds for her pigs. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP,  in order to improve the output of her piggery. In the near future, she wants to have a better life for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Davy is a 38-year old widow who resides in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has three children.

Davy has worked in a factory since 2008. One of her children also works in the factory. Another is a car mechanic and the remaining one is in school. Together the family earns approximately $16 a day.

Davy would like to build a proper kitchen for cooking, but needs a loan to buy lumber and zinc sheets. In the future, she wants to run a tailoring business in her home and support her child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is 40 years old and has three children. Marianita is married and has three children who are in school.

Marianita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marianita requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marianita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
