loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old and is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Editha has a food vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Editha has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old and married, with four children. With one child currently in school, Juliana works very hard to provide for them.

Juliana runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Juliana has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, sugar, canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, and cereals. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juliana would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and has four children. Helen is married and has three children who are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers for her fish-vending business.

Emma has been in this business for six years. Emma earns more income from raising pigs.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 36 years old and has three children. Joan is a married woman and has three children who are in school.

Joan is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Joan requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joan has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estilita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Estilita works hard to support her family.

She has a laundry business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Estilita is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more laundry soap and feed for her pigs.

Estilita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more laundry soap and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for five years. Erlinda earns more income from farming seaweed.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorna is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lorna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Lorna has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Lorybel

texts.en:
Lorybel is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lorybel is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorybel has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old, with six children. With three children in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, coffee, and groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, coffee, and groceries.

loans.name: Noel Alfredo

texts.es:
Noel, de 26 años de edad, estudio sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de la ciudad y tiene una niña de 8 meses de nacida.

Noel, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, este negocio lo realiza desde que tenía 20 años de edad, fue él patrón quien le enseño a negociar ganado, se decidió a trabajar de esta manera porque es una buena fuente de ingreso y genera buenas ganancias.

Noel, con el crédito comprará ganado de repasto.
Noel, lo que desea en un futuro, es formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Noel is 26 year sold and has a sixth grade education.  He is married and his wife sells vegetables at the market in town.  They also have an 8 month old daughter.

Noel buys and sells livestock and has been doing this since he was 20 years old.  His employer taught him how to manage livestock and he decided to do this because it’s a good source of income.

He will use the money to buy livestock.  Noel wants to form his own family in the future.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Kokies Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Jenny María, Esmeralda y Elvia) de la etnia miskita,  de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que continúan luchando día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios. Jenny María vende de ropa nueva, Elvia tiene una pequeña pulpería y Esmeralda vende ropa usada. Con el primer préstamo que le dio Kiva lograron incrementar sus inventarios en sus pequeños negocios, Jenny ahora vende vestidos, camisetas y blusas.   

Esmeralda: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, luchadora, tiene 59 años de edad, es viuda, tiene siete hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 20 años genera sus propios ingresos vendiendo ropa usada de manera ambulante y en el corredor de su casa también exhibe las ropas que vende. Con el préstamo que está solicitando quiere comprar pacas de ropa mixta usada de mejor calidad para realizar las ventas más rápido.  También quiere vender frijoles cocidos. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería y un negocio próspero.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three women: Jenny María, Esmeralda, and Elvia. They are of Miskito ethnicity and live in Bilwi, a town in Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who continue to strive each day in order to grow their small businesses. Jenny María sells new clothes, Elvia has a small grocery store, and Esmeralda sells used clothes. With the first loan that they received from Kiva, the women were able to increase the inventories of their small businesses. Jenny now sells dresses, T-shirts, and blouses.

Esmeralda is a member of this solidarity group. She is a friendly and determined woman. Esmeralda is 59 years old, widowed, and has six grown children. For the past 20 years, she has generated her own income by selling used clothes as a street vendor. She also sells by displaying clothes from the corridor of her house. With the loan she is requesting, Esmeralda will buy mixed bales of used clothing of the best quality so that she can make quicker sales. She also wants to sell cooked beans. Her dream is to open a grocery store and have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy mixed bales of high quality used clothes.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business preparing dried fish. She has been in this business for eight years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans through NWTF. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more fish and ingredients. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish and other ingredients.

loans.name: Titsophany

texts.en: Titsophany is a 46-year-old married farmer with three children, who resides in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has cultivated rice and fattened animals since 1985. Her husband is 47 years old and he earns income from buying and selling pigs. In addition, he has a motorcycle with an open trailer to carry water to sell. All three children are in school. Together, Titsophany and her husband can make around USD $15 a day. Her husband’s present motorcycle and trailer are old, so she would like to apply for a loan for him to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to carry water to sell. Titsophany supports her children's education and wants to help them to earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with a trailer to carry water to sell

loans.name: Birame

texts.fr: Monsieur Birame habite dans un village situé à environ 35km de la ville principale. Il est célibataire sans enfant. Il s’active dans le domaine du commerce, exactement dans la vente de produits de mercerie. C’est en 2006, qu’il a démarré son activité avec un petit fond de 50 000f. Cette dernière qui consiste à aller dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour vendre ses produits de mercerie. Grâce à son activité, Birame s’occupe des charges familiales. Il a aussi ouvert un compte d’épargne à terme afin de pouvoir réaliser ses objectifs. Il pense élargir son commerce en ouvrant une cantine dans le marché où il vendrait des tissus et de l’habillement unisexe.
texts.en:
Mr. Birame lives in a village located about 35 km from the main town. He is unmarried and has no children. He is activing in the domain of commerce, the selling of sewing supplies to be exact. In 2006, he started his business with the small amount of 50,000 francs. It involves going to weekly markets to sell his sewing supply products. 

Thanks to his business, Birame is taking care of family expenses. He has also opened a savings account to be able to realize his goals. He is thinking of expanding his business by opening a stall at the market, where he used to sell fabrics and unisex clothing.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies to resell

loans.name: Rowila

texts.en:
Rowila is 31 years old, married, and has two children. 

She has owned and managed a small sari-sari store business for one year already. She became a member of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2014 and borrowed a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store, to increase her inventory and have more sales, so that she can generate more income from the sales of her sari-sari store. 

In the future, Rowila wants her family to have a better life and to generate savings out of the income of her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr:
Latyr est un jeune agriculteur qui s’active depuis 12 ans dans ce domaine. Il est marié et père de famille. Il possède un champ où il fait du maraichage. Il y travaille le matin de 6h du matin à 10h et s’occupe lui-même de l’entretien comme on le voit sur la photo. Latyr n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et aimerait faire du stockage de céréales avec le crédit sollicité. 
Vivant en famille dans son village, il se partage les charges familiales avec ses frères. Et c’est grâce à l’activité de maraichage et de stockage, qu’il réussi à améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. 
Latyr souhaite élargir son activité de maraichage et le développer en cultivant des fruits et des légumes.
texts.en:
Latyr is a young farmer who has been active in this domain for twelve years. He is married and a father. He owns a field where he practices market gardening. He works there from 6 AM to 10 AM, and he himself takes care of the upkeep, as is pictured in the photo. 

Latyr has never benefited from an IMCEC loan and would like to stock up on grains with the loan requested. Living with family in his village, he and his brothers help to cover family expenses. Thanks to his work in  market gardening and in stocking grains, he has succeed in improving his family’s food situation. Latyr would like to expand his market gardening business and develop it by growing fruit & vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase grains to stock up and resell later on

loans.name: Khunny

texts.en:
Khunny, 47 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has three unmarried children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. Beside this, she also runs a small grocery store at the market in her community. She has been in business for more than 20 years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD $10 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Segundo Raul

texts.es:
Segundo Raul tiene 20 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hija, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, la actividad a la que se dedican sus pobladores es la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, esta comunidad se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Son una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener un mejor futuro, su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio desde hace dos años y Segundo Raúl realiza labores agrícolas. El ha decidido apoyar a su esposa y ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como chivos, vacas, carneros, entre otros, así como alimento balanceado para la crianza de estos. De esta manera Segundo Raul espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener mayores ingresos, lo que le va a permitir incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo Raul is 20 years old and lives with his wife and child in a large community in the urban area of Cayaltí. People in this area work in agriculture and small animal sales. This community is located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú.

They are a tight-knit family, working for a better future. For the past two years, his wife has raised animals in their backyard and sold them. And Segundo Raul has worked in agriculture for the past two years. He has decided to support his wife by requesting a loan to purchase a greater number of animals such as baby goats, cows, male sheep and others. He will also purchase food to nourish these animals. In this way, Segundo Raul hopes to grow the business and increase their income, which will enable him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of animals.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 37 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig-fattening.

Melanie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 54 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by buying and selling chickens in the Philippines. Mildred is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Mildred has been buying and selling chickens for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Sariat

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Sariat who has been with Ruma for more than a year. This is the second time that Sariat is applying for a Kiva loan.
Sariat and his wife live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Sariat owns a stall where he sells many things. He sells daily consumer products, snacks and drinks, and mobile phone airtime and provides utility bill payments service for his customers. 

For the last four months, Sariat has been selling a new product from Ruma called Mapan, which is an e-commerce service for low-income communities. With Mapan, Sariat is able to connect people in his community to many good quality products at good prices. 
Sariat is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Sariat is with his wife in front of his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in her community

loans.name: Franklin Onan

texts.es:
Franklin, de 19 años de edad, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

Franklin, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero solicito el crédito para construir un estanque de peces, ya tiene la pila hecha de tierra, pero tendrá que botarla y construirla nuevamente de bloque, porque para tener peces no es recomendable.

El crédito es para comprar bloque, cemento, hierro, arena y piedra; para construir el estanque. 

El sueño de Franklin es, tener un estanque de peces, para que cuando forme su propia familia pueda tener ingresos para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Franklin is 19 years old. He only studied until 9th grade. He is single and live with his parents. Franklin does not have any type of business, but requests this loan to build a fish pond. He already has a pond dug in the earth, but he would like to get rid of this and build it anew from cement, because it doesn't currently serve well to hold fish. The loan is to purchase blocks, cement, iron, sand and stone to construct the pond. Franklin's dream is to have this pond full of fish so that when he starts his own family he will have an income to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to build a pond.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Eddy, who has been with Ruma for around three years. This is Eddy’s fourth time applying for a Kiva loan. His business has been improved very much. He also has an advantage selling to people because he has a humble and friendly approach to his customers. Eddy and his wife live in West Bogor, a suburban area located about 1.5 hours’ drive from Jakarta, the capital city. They have been blessed with three daughters and one son.

Eddy owns a stall where he sells many things. He sells daily consumer products, snacks and drinks, and mobile phone airtime and provides utility bill payments service for his customers. 

For the last four months, Eddy has been selling a new product from Ruma called Mapan, which is an e-commerce service for low-income communities. With Mapan, Eddy is able to connect people in his community to many good quality products at good prices. 
Eddy is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payment transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Eddy is standing in his stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile services in his community

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en: Phoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Deniz

texts.en:
Deniz is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“When I was a one-year-old child, my father passed away. My mother brought me up alone. She was a teacher at a local institute, with a salary of USD 153 per month. Of course, it wasn’t enough money for our daily expenses, so she used to over-work and take extra classes. In such a way, she could earn about USD 529 per month. 

"In 2013, she was diagnosed with a terrible disease and had chemotherapy twice. She left her job since she wasn’t physically able to continue working. Due to her special treatment, I couldn’t help her alone and we moved to my grandparents’ house. Thanks to our relatives, I could continue my studies and there was always someone to care for my mother.

"Unfortunately, in November 2014, I lost my mother too. I still live with my grandparents and try to think of everything good and to dream. It’s hard to bear all these difficulties, but I should be strong and realize my goals. From childhood, my mother wanted me to be well-educated, financially independent, and morally and physically strong. I believe I can do it!

"Academic freedom, freedom from corruption, and academic honesty, especially on the teachers’ side, is a great example for Central Asia of how institutions can be of a great benefit to society! It is really inspiring to be together with great people and extraordinary students from many different countries. Great international and local teachers help us see where we stand, in terms of knowledge, and where we should aim. 

"Currently Kiva is a chance for me to keep studying at AUCA and continue achieving goals by myself.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
Guido es  soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación de ladrillo con pisos de tierra,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la población de Palomar.
Actualmente trabaja por mas de doce horas al día dedicándose por completo al cultivo de hortalizas y con los ingresos que tiene cubre los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
En esta ocasion Guido necesita un credito para  comprar toros que pueda engordar, sucede que en esta epoca del año Guido tiene mucha cantidad de pasto en su terreno y eso puede ser muy util para el engorde de ganado
texts.en: Guido is single and has no children, and lives at home with his parents in a brick room with a dirt floor. The house is located in the community of Palomar. Currently he works over twelve hours a day growing vegetables and uses the income to cover food expenses and utility payments. This time Guido needs a loan to purchase bulls to fatten. This time of year Guido has a large amount of pasture on his land and that can be very useful for fattening cattle.

loans.use: To purchase bulls.

loans.name: Rosalío

texts.es:
Rosalío es un hombre casado de 22 años con dos hijos; el varón tiene 4 años y la mujercita tiene 2 años vive en una comunidad de Sololá junto a su esposa. 

Rosalio su junto con su esposa desde muy temprana edad, él trabaja actualmente de albañil, construyendo casas, muros, y todo lo relacionado en la línea de construcción, este trabajo empezó hace cuatro años, con ese trabajo  sostiene a sus hijos,  Además de este trabajo, Rosalío también se dedica ahora a la agricultura pero esto es gracias a un préstamo  que obtuvo, donde pudo comprar insumos para emprender la agricultura, ahora con estas dos actividades, Rosalio en coordinación con su esposa se ponen de acuerdo  y buscan un segundo préstamo, esto préstamo les servirá para la compra de materiales de construcción, para poder empezar la primera fase de su casa , ya que la meta de Rosario es tener un hogar más cómodo para su familia , el ahora vive en una casa de lamina, como se puede apreciar en la fotografía 

La meta de Rosalio es  conseguir el préstamo y hacer realidad sus sueños, para que  sus hijos, tengan un espacio agradable,  como  el sueño de todo padre de familia.
texts.en:
Rosalío, 22, is married and has two children, a four-year-old son and a two-year-old daughter.  He and his wife live in a community in Sololá.  He got together with her at a very young age.

Currently he works as a bricklayer building houses, walls, and everything having to do with construction.  He started this job four years ago and he supports his children with it.  In addition to this job Rosalío also works in agriculture thanks to a loan he got to buy supplies to get started.

With these two jobs now, Rosalío and his wife agree on getting a second loan to buy construction materials to start the first phase of their home.

Rosalío's goal is to have a more comfortable home for his family.  Currently he lives in a house made of metal sheeting, as seen in the photograph.  His goal is to get the loan and, like any father, make his dreams a reality so his children have a pleasant space.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para vivienda

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en el  ciclo número 5 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. En ciclos anteriores se ha hecho las encuestas de eliminación de pobreza, donde algunas señoras  se encontraban por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero están creciendo y mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ofelia quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de forma ambulante. Ella es muy buena haciendo las comidas, es por ello que le va muy bien y tiene una clientela bien formada.
Pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con la venta de sus comidas.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) is in its fifth loan cycle with the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to get ahead. In previous loan cycles, the members have taken the poverty elimination survey. The results indicated that some of the women were below the poverty line, but they have been growing and improving.

One of the members is Sra. Ofelia, who sells food that she prepares herself. She goes out to sell her dishes as a street vendor. Ofelia is very good at preparing food. For this reason, she is doing very well and has built up an established clientele.

Ofelia is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making her dishes such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other items. This will help her to continue her food sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer que le encanta prosperar en la vida, ella tiene 49 años, pero aun no descansa para buscar el bienestar de su familia. 

Catarina lo que se propone en la vida  se le hace realidad, ella desde hace mucho tiempo anhelaba  tener un molino de nixtamal, pues ella se propuso  buscar un préstamo y lo obtuvo con eso logro instalar su molino, ese fue su primer crédito, sin el préstamo no lo hubiera podido hacer. Ahora tiene una fuente de ingreso, Catarina para este año se ha propuesto comprar un terreno para dejarles como herencia a sus hijos, por la misma razón ella está buscando un segundo préstamo, ya con el negocio que  ella  tiene siente la capacidad de pagar el segundo préstamo, la meta de ella es conseguir el préstamo para aprovechar hacer esta compra. 

Catarina manifiesta que los prestamos son muy buenos ya que por medio de ello uno logro hacer muchas cosas en la vida. Catarina seguirá apoyando a su familia hasta donde pueda mientras Dios le da vida. Otro sueño grande de Catarina es comprar una moto taxi para emprender un segundo negocio.
texts.en:
Catarina is a woman who loves to prosper in life. She is 49 years old, but she still doesn't rest in working for the well-being of her family. 

The goals Catarina sets herself in life, she achieves. For a long time she longed to have a corn mill, so she decided to look for a loan and she got one, with which she installed her mill. This was her first loan, without which she wouldn't have been able to buy the mill. Now she has a source of income. 

This year Catarina has decided to buy a piece of land to leave to her children as their inheritance. For this reason she is looking for a second loan. As she feels capable of paying this second loan from her business, her challenge is to get the loan in order to make this purchase.

Catarina says that the loans are really good because through them you can achieve many things in life. Catarina will continue supporting her family as far as she can while God gives her life. Another of Catarina's big dreams is to buy a motorbike taxi to be able to set up a second business.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ceramic tiles, cement, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es: Vilma de 43 años es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Este es el grupo “Los Capullitos” conformada por 10 socias responsables y trabajadoras. Vilma se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Así mismo como actividad secundaria se desempeña como ayudante de transporte público. El crédito que solicitó lo destinó para la compra de telas, hilos, cierres y botones. Su mayor deseo es mejorar su taller y de esta manera ofrecer distintas variedades de prendas. El grupo “Los Capullitos” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Vilma se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste de polo plomo.
texts.en:
This is the group "Los Capullitos", consisting of 10 responsible and hard-working members. Vilma, 43 years old, is separated, and has 1 dependent child. Vilma makes a living by tailoring apparel. She also has a second income from serving as a bus steward. The loan that she is requesting is earmarked for the purchase of fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons. Her greatest wish is to improve her workshop, and thus offer different varieties of garments. 

The group "Los Capullitos" is thankful to the people who have made this loan possible. Vilma is the first person seated on the left side, and is wearing a gray t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La socia Adriana pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” del distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco.
La socia Adriana continua con su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platós para vender a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,la socia continua vendiendo de manera ambuklatoria,la sodia elabora deiferets tipos de platos como arroz con pollo,saltados ,sopas entre otros,siendpo de esta mnaa que la socias aca adelanrte a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes,aceite,menesatras entre otros.

Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de gelatinas, fotocopiadoras, imprenta, multiservicios, restaurante.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Adriana belongs to the "Señor de Huanca" communal bank group in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Adriana continues with her food sales. She makes different dishes to sell to her customers who ask for them. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She continues selling as a street vendor. She makes different sorts of dishes such as rice and chicken, stir fries, and soups, among others, being in this way that she gets her family ahead.

She asks for the loan to purchase meat, oil, and legumes among others. 

The other members work selling jellies, photocopies, printing, in a multi-service center, and in a restaurant. 

The group member who is in the photo attached was unable to be in the group photo due to her other work obligations.

loans.use: to purchase meat, oil, and legumes, among others.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El socio Roger pertenece al banco comunal TERESA DE JESUS, el socio Roger tiene 46 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es separado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institución publica en el área de administración, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio a la vez se dedica a la venta de libros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio Roger solicita el crédito para la compra de libros para su negocio.
El socio Roger se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member,Roger is 46 and belongs to Teresa de Jesús Communal Bank.  He has one child and is separated, and he alternates his daily activities working in administration in a public institution.  Roger has been in this job for some time now and it's going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into the business every day.

He also works as a bookseller, which is how he makes progress with his family.  Roger is requesting the loan to buy books for his business.

He's grateful for this loan and promises to make his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy books for his business

loans.name: Urpi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “URPI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana ella es soltera y tiene 29 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales,la socia es un amujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “URPI.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member Roxana is single, 29 years old and has 1 child.  She works at her business of selling cereal grains.  She is an enterprising and hard-working woman.  Through this business she supports her child.  She sells corn, wheat and quinoa.  She works from 8AM until 5PM.  She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her.  

Her dream is to have premises from which she can sell the cereal grains.  She is asking for the loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The member whose photo is attached to the group photo asked permission to have the picture taken after the group meeting because of work.

The other members have a restaurant sales business, a business selling clothes, a small grocery store and a photocopy business.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old, married and has three children. She is selling fruits, vegetables, meat and fish to the people in her village on a house-to-house basis using her bicycle. 

She is very patient in achieving income so that she can sustain her family's needs, especially for education purposes. She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy fish and vegetables to sell. 

She will increase her merchandise to increase her profits, too. Editha hopes to save funds for her family's emergency expenses.

loans.use: to buy fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she earns more income from farming seaweeds.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her fishing business.

Purification has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, fish containers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 47years old and a married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 35 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Noemi is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Noemi has been in pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 50 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her bicycle taxi.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her bicycle taxi.

loans.name: Teodolfa

texts.en:
Teodolfa is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

Teodolfa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack food, soft-drinks and other groceries.

She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teodolfa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rufina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rufina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Pelita

texts.en:
Pelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of making artificial teeth in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her dentures business.

Pelita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Pelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her dentures business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small plot of land which will serve as a chicken coop and, with this, provide her daughter with an education.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 37 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Noemi works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Noemi has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Noemi would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martha Sebastiana

texts.es:
Martha, de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, pues no pudo terminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, esta soltera, vive con cuatro hermanos y sus padres, ellos tienen una tienda familiar y también trabajan en la elaboración de hamacas.  

Martha, junto a su familia tiene una pequeña tienda en la casa desde hace dos años, en la cual venden productos de la canasta básica y también elaboran hamacas de seda y de poli-seda desde que tenía 11 años de edad, no tiene horarios, ella atiende la tienda todo el día y a la vez está elaboración las hamacas.

Martha, solicita el crédito para comprar seda y otros materiales, para la elaboración de las hamacas y así poder tener el material suficiente, para poder satisfacer a sus clientes en cuanto a la producción de hamacas y seguir generando ese ingreso económico a su hogar, para cubrir las necesidades económicas.

Ella sueña con poder hacer crecer su negocio de hamacas y aumentar el inventario de la tienda familiar que tiene, para seguir sustentando a su familia y así ir poco a poco mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.- Además, el próximo año, le gustaría volver a estudiar para terminar su formación básica.
texts.en:
Martha, 20, studied up to sixth grade, but was unable to finish her studies due to a lack of economic resources. She is single, and lives with four siblings and her parents. They have a family shop and they also make hammocks.  

Martha and her family have had a small shop in their house for 2 years, where they sell basic consumer goods, and they have also made silk and poly-silk hammocks since she was 11 years old. They don't have a work timetable. She looks after the shop all day and makes the hammocks at the same time. 

Martha is asking for a loan to buy silk and other materials with which to make the hammocks so that they have sufficient material to satisfy their customers in terms of hammock production. This will allow them to continue making this economic income in their household, to cover the basic costs of living.

She dreams of being able to expand the hammock business and improve the inventory of the family shop in order to continue supporting her family and be able to improve bit by bit her quality of life and that of her family. Furthermore, next year she would like to go back to studying, in order to finish her basic education.

loans.use: to buy silk and other materials with which to make hammocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise and pay a debt; and with this income she will be able to grow in her life.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se unió en la ciudad de Encarnación, son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se pusieron como meta el crecimiento de cada una de ellas. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder ir mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Wilma es parte de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa que a montado poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante por medio de su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Comenta que quiere seguir creciendo para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser: artículos de primera necesidad, panificados, artículos enlatados, bebidas, y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Encarnación. The members are hardworking women who have set a goal of helping one another grow. They are also participating in the poverty elimination program, which will help them to improve their poverty situation.

Wilma is part of this group. She has a food pantry that she established over time and with much effort. Wilma is a hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead as a result of her effort and sacrifice. She says that she wants to keep growing so that she can provide her family a decent life without deprivation.

Wilma is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her food pantry such as basic necessities, baked goods, canned goods, beverages, and other products. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities, baked goods, canned goods, beverages, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes qui en plus des liens de solidarité et parental qui les unies, viennent d’avoir quatre cycles qui ont soudé d’avantage ces liens. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 05 enfants  dont 04 garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de produit alimentaires (sucre cristalline, thé vert, et divers bonbons pour enfant) et des épices. Elle achète sa marchandise au marché hebdomadaire communal pour la revente au détail dans son village.

Avec ce prêt, elle désire acheter une grosse de thé vert pour 9 000 F CFA, un sac de sucre à 22 750 F CFA et le reste pour diverses sucreries.

Les bénéfices servent à aider son mari dans les charges de la famille ainsi qu’a assurer une meilleure scolarité aux enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up on October 18, 2012 and carries the name of the village where it is housed. Within the group are women who, in addition to ties of solidarity and kinship uniting them, just finished four loan cycles, which have further strengthened these ties. The women have as their main work small-scale commerce along with rainy-season farming.

Ms. Fatou (standing at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 51 years old and a married mother of five children, of whom four are boys, and one is a girl. Ms. Fatou is active in selling grocery items (crystalline sugar, green tea, and a variety of candies for children), and spices. She purchases her merchandise at the weekly communal market and then resells the goods retail in her village. 

With this loan, she wishes to purchase a quantity of green tea at 9,000 francs CFA, a bag of sugar at 22,750 francs. and a variety of sweets. 

The profits will be used to help out her husband in covering family expenses, as well as to ensure a better education for the children.

loans.use: buy a quantity of green tea for 9,000 CFA francs, a bag of sugar for 22,750 CFA francs, and the rest for various sweets.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge-A Group

texts.en:
Halima is the mother of four kids who are in school. She is in her early thirties and married. For three years now, she has been supporting her family by running a beauty salon, with herself being a hairstylist. She starts working from 7am to 10pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her fourth credit request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to improve on her service, bought hair products and paid rent to her business premise. She is really appreciative of Kiva's support. Halima dreams of improving and expanding her business. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She received some extra income which she used to cover part of the school fees and household expenses.

With her new credit request, Halima will invest in buying hair dressing products for her salon. She will share this credit with her members from Mkombozi-Mwenge A group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair dressing products for her salon.

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Agness is 43 years old, married, and has three children; one is schooling and the rest are grown. She is a hardworking woman who has devoted her lifetime to business. She runs a grocery selling beers, sodas, water, juices and spirits. Agness has been in this business for seven years now, working from 04pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good return per month. 

This is her twelfth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits to replenish her grocery with more drinks. Her business now looks attractive and she has more customers. She is so thankful for Kiva's support. 

Agness' dream is to build a house, and from there she will be so comfortable that she will be able to put all her mind toward business expansion. She managed to pay back successfully her previous loans. She used the profit earned to cover part of her child's school fees and home expenses. 

Agness will use her new credit to replenish her grocery with beers, sodas, water, spirits and juices. She will share this credit with her four other members of the Mkombozi Mwenge group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her grocery with beers, sodas, water, spirits and juices.

loans.name: Monte De Sion Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Monte de Sion lo integran tres socios laboriosos, que solicitan por sexta ocasión en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios, está coordinado por Rita una mujer emprendedora que lucha cada día para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, tiene la edad de 31 años, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos quienes son su mayor motivación para su superación, tienen las edades de 12, 11 años y unos gemelos de la edad de 7 años. Su negocio es la venta de productos varios (como es platanitos, yuquitas, gaseosas, etc.), en el centro de salud de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace seis años de los ahorros obtenidos de su trabajo anterior (zona franca), el crédito lo solicita para la compra de plátano verde, yuca, aceite, leña, bolsas, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar los productos ofrecidos, y lo que ella considera lo más importante es que a sus hijos no les hace falta el alimento a diario. El resto de los integrantes son, Iliana tiene la edad de 49 años y cuenta con una experiencia de diez años en la comercialización de espejo en su domicilio y en las calles de su comunidad, y José un joven laborioso que ofrece el servicio de comida en su comunidad desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
Three hard-working members make up the Monte de Sion support group, who are asking for their sixth loan from ADIM to finance their businesses. The group is coordinated by Rita, an enterprising woman who strives on a daily basis to improve her family's living conditions. She is single and has 4 children who are her main driving force to get on in life. They are 12 and 11 years old and 7-year-old twins.

Rita has a business selling various products  (such as plantain chips, fried cassava, fizzy drinks etc.) in her community health centre. She started this business up six years ago with money saved from her previous job (in the free trade zone). She is asking for the loan to buy green bananas, cassava, oil, firewood, bags etc. With the previous loans she has been able to increase the products she offers. For her the most important thing is that her children have enough food every day.

The other members are Iliana who is 49 years old and has 10 years' experience selling mirrors in her home and around the streets in her local area, and José, a hard-working young man who has been serving food in his community for five years.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, cassava, oil, wood and other products to sell

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto lives at Enrile with his family. He is 50 years old. To sustain his family's daily needs, he sells fish, meat, and vegetables within his village using his bicycle. He patiently offers his products to his customers.

He is now asking for additional capital of PHP 11,000 needed to expand his business. He will buy fish, meat, and vegetables (eggplant, tomatoes, squash) to sell. It will also increase the capacity of sales and give good profits in return.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat, and vegetables (eggplant, tomatoes, squash) to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old, married and had three children. She is a hog raiser and has been very patient in growing her piglets. She sells them to butchers upon achieving the desired weight.

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs’ sustenance. She hopes to become a successful hog raiser someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Elvi

texts.en:
Elvi is 40 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries.

Elvi has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods and cosmetics.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Esterlita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Esterlita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dried fish to offer for sale.

Esterlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish to offer for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 29 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 48 years old and married with two children.

Romana earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Romana has been raising livestock for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Yoradyl

texts.en:
Yoradyl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Yoradyl has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Yoradyl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making and selling hollow blocks. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Helen has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She requested a PHP 21,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of lumber to sell. Gaudiosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Patrocinia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Patrocinia has been in a pig fattening business for 30 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 37 years old and married with four children who are still in school. Marialyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc. Marialyn has been in this business for 5 years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. She would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, soap, sugar, bread, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Andres

texts.es:
Por recomendación de sus clientes Jorge, un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad quien tiene una Heladería, iniciada a principios de agosto de 2014, en la cual deposita todo su esfuerzo y esperanza pues sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar, donde lo esperan sus padres con un plato de alimento que sale de las ganancias de la heladería, Jorge quiere adecuar mejor su heladería, tener más variedad de sabores y una fuerza de publicidad.
Por tal razón Jorge quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido de sabores de helado, invertir en acrílicos para adecuar a su heladería y publicidad para su negocio, desde cartillas, volantes, promociones etc.
texts.en:
From the recommendations of his customers, Jorge, a single 27 year old man who has an ice cream shop, opened it at the beginning of August 2014. In this, he puts all his efforts and hopes since he dreams of improving the living conditions of his household, where his parents wait for him with a plate of food which is made from the ice cream shop earnings. Jorge wants to fix up his ice cream shop to make it look better and offer more variety in the flavors, as well as increase good advertising.

For this reason, Jorge wants to ask for a loan to purchase an assortment of ice cream flavors, invest in acrylics to fix up his ice cream shop, and advertising for his business from booklets, to flyers, promotions, etc.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of ice cream flavors, and invest in acrylics to fix up his ice cream shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete her license in marketing, in this way to be able to develop her knowledge and interaction with the customer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the inventory of basic products and other items.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.es:
La Sra. Tomasita es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo se ha abierto camino para poder tener una mejor vida, y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar en su negocio.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas y calzados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasita is a hardworking and enterprising woman who is doing her best to make a way for herself to have a better life and to provide her family with everything they need. She says that her previous loan was invested in the purchase of clothes, which was a great help. Tomasita is extremely grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can improve her business.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes and shoes. This will enable her to continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy constructions materials, like sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to upgrade his barbershop with nice pictures, paint and shaving tools.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es: Mariano de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra granos básicos y también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una yunta de bueyes para poder trabajar en la tierra y continuar con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano, age 46, lives in a house of his own along with his family. For the last 20 years he has worked in agriculture, specifically with staple grains. He has also worked rearing bovine cattle. He sells his products in the surroundings of the area where he lives. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a yoke of oxen that will help him to work the land and continue with his farming, thus improving his earnings and his quality of life

loans.use: to buy a yoke of oxen.

loans.name: Silbia Virginia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito El Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Silbia, tiene 40 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 16  años de edad, ambos  estudian en universidad y  colegio. El marido es abogado.
Doña Silbia  con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto darles lo mejor a sus hijos desde hace ocho años atrás con lo que tenia y con la ayuda de su marido surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres en un local que arrienda cerca de su casa, allí ella vende además de víveres también ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, ella espera que ahora con la ayuda de los créditos su negocio prospere aun mas, allí pasa el día brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes, sus hijos le ayudan cuando ellos pueden, aunque es ella la que siempre está atenta a brindar la mejor atención, ya son 8 años con su negocio el cual le da muy buenas satisfacciones. 
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda. Lleva 8 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Credit Group El Nuevo Amanecer meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented during all times of the year and for being a city with an unrivaled beauty with many tourist attractions. Silbia lives in this city. She is 40 years old, married and from this marriage has two children, a 22-year-old and a 16-year-old, both of whom are studying in university and school. Her husband is a lawyer. 
Silbia,in order to make something for herself and use this to provide the best for her children, with what she had and with the help of her husband, started a small grocery store six years ago in a location she rents near her home. There she sells groceries in addition to certain bazaar and stationery items. She hopes that now with the help of loans her business will prosper even more, and there she will go on providing the best service to her customers. Her children help her when they can, but it is she who always makes an attempt to provide the best service, as she has for 8 years run a business that provides satisfaction. 
This loan is to buy groceries to supply her store. She has worked with the Credit Group for 8 years and she likes to work with the group because it provides loans quickly. Her dream is to continue moving forward and to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en: Wilhelmina is 51 years old, married and has six children. Some of her children are already employed. She is raising hogs to sell upon achieving the desired weight as a source of income. She wanted to ensure good growth of the hogs and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 now. She will buy feed and rice bran for sustenance of the hogs. With proper maintenance, she will be able to sell her hogs at a higher cost someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for sustenance of the hogs.

loans.name: Wanmer

texts.es:
Wanmer tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Wanmer es al cultivo de cacao, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de cacao así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la productividad de su negocio y ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes, lo que le reportará mayores niveles de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wanmer, age 37, lives in his own house, which is made of basic material, with his wife and son in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca region, on the northern highlands of Peru.  The community where he lives is a small rural area where the inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, with livestock, and in commerce.

Wanmer is dedicated to the cultivation of cocoa and has experience in the industry and with very good personal and work references in the area. Additionally he works raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens , ducks , turkeys, among others. The loan is used to purchase fertilizer. The fertilizer will be used to maintain cocoa cultivation and for hiring labor to harvest time. This investment will allow you to improve his business productivity and provide a better quality product to its customers, which will then report higher levels of income and thus improve the quality of life of Wanmer and his family.

loans.use: The loan is used to purchase fertilizer and fertilizer to support growing cocoa crops and for hiring extra labor at harvest time

loans.name: Norma Marina

texts.es:
Norma Marina tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Norma Marina espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo de esta manera sus gustos y preferencias lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y le permitirá incrementar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma Marina is 43 years old, she lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru. The people in this region work in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.

She makes a living raising and selling smaller animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located at the back of her house. She has regular customers who give her very good personal and professional references.

The loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, as well as buying balanced feed to fatten them.

With this loan, Norma Marina hopes to offer her customers a larger variety of animals, to satisfy their likes and preferences, which will be reflected in a higher level of income and will allow her to increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, as well as buying balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Su población se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de café de la variedad catimore desde hace 4 años, su cultivo esta cerca a su vivienda lo que le ha permitido a su esposa apoyarle en esta labor. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, con esto Anastacio espera ofrecer un producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su negocio y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 52 years old and lives in with his wife and their young children in a house made of basic materials. They reside in the District of Santo Tomás in Cutervo Province, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The residents engage in agriculture and trade as their main business activities.

Anastacio is a farmer who has been specializing in growing coffee of the Catimor variety for the past four years. His crops are located near his home, which allows his wife to help him with the work. Anastacio has experience in this line of work and also very good personal and work-related references who are from the area.

His loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop. With this loan, Anastacio hopes to offer a better quality product to his customers. This will have a great impact on his business, which will help him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a banana vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers for her banana vending business. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Adelaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 60 years old, married and has one child.

Elena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elena has been in this business for 19 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Genly

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Genly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her catering service. Genly is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional foods like meat and other frozen foods for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Genly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods like meat and other frozen foods.

loans.name: Ardianita

texts.en:
Ardianita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Ardianita has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Ardianita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Irish has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials like shells, wires, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Irish would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
