loans.use: to purchase more raw materials like shells, wires, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Medjielyn

texts.en:
Medjielyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell crabs business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell for her business.

Medjielyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Jonafe

texts.en:
Jonafe is thirty-seven years old and has four children.  

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jonafe requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of agricultural products to sell.

Jonafe has been working in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonafe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of agricultural products

loans.name: Ma. Peb

texts.en:
Ma. Peb is a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Peb is twenty-five years old.

Ma. Peb has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Peb requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed for her piglets.

Ma. Peb has been in this business for four years. In future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her piglets

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. Marissa is married and has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for eight years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Virgintina

texts.en:
Virgintina works hard to support her family. Virgintina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Virgintina requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Virgintina has been in this business for forty years now.

Virgintina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 37 years old and has 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Lorna has already borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 2 years, though she also earns income from selling poultry supplies.

Lorna aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ummoja

texts.en:
Ummoja is a married mother of five children. Four of them attend school and the fifth child is still too young for school. Ummoja owns a house that  neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
“When people come together, they are powerful,” says Fredrick, a 42-year-old farmer who has 3 children and lives in the village of Chogoria in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

At a young age Fredrick watched people in his village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led him to join Kaibu self-help group. For the past year, Fredrick has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because he is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere, and men do the heavy work. This has not been a setback as Fredrick has been able to make great profits in crop and goat farming. 

Chuka is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, good soils, a transport system, and a market. Fredrick has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge he has been facing is lack of funds. He is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. 

Through the Kaibu self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Fredrick joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan he intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow him to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling him to earn more money. 

This loan will improve Fredrick’s living conditions and secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman and has two school going children. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanaidi has operated a business renting houses to the community. In addition she also operates a phone charging business which earns her another source of income. She faces a challenge of delayed payments, hence low profits in her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES that she is requesting she wants to establish more rental houses, so she wants to purchase cement and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand for construction.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a cosmetics selling shop business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passerby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Norma Luisa

texts.es:
Laboriosa y soñadora, son dos palabras que describen perfectamente a Norma, una mujer trabajadora y de familia, que hace lo que este a su alcance para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposo.
Se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos en el municipio de Sonson.
Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región y gran parte de sus habitantes la practican.
Ella posee gran conocimiento en esta materia y considera que necesita un pequeño impulso para incrementar sus ventas y aumentar su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un auxilio económico para invertirlo en la compra concentrado y alimento para sus pollos.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar con su actividad que es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia.
Se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y con la Corporación Interactuar que hacen posible que su negocio crezca y mejore.
texts.en:
Hard-working and dreamer are words that perfectly describe Norma, a hard working family woman who does everything she can to offer a better quality of life to her children and her husband.

She farms and sells chickens in the Sonson municipality, a very common job in this region, performed by a large portion of the inhabitants.

She knows a lot about this subject, and believes that she needs a small boost to increase her sales and allow her business to grow, which is why she is requesting financial assistance which she can use to buy feed for her chickens.

With this loan she will be able to continue her work, which is her family's only source of income.

She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and the Interactuar corporation who have made the growth and improvement of her business possible.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en: Samnang’s Group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samnang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase stylish and new women's clothes to sell in her quarter.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo’s motto is “the mind creates; the body attracts; fate makes it happen.”  He coined this quote and he uses it every day to inspire his clients through health and fitness. 

He moved to San Diego nearly 20 years ago, after almost completing law school in Brazil.  Wanting to get away, he visited San Diego for a vacation and decided to stay.  Always into fitness and maintaining a healthy lifestyle, it was the completion of his first IronMan that led him to consider it as a career. 

He got a job at a local athletic club and received his personal training certifications.  He worked there for nearly four years, but always wanted to do more.  For Marcelo, it’s not strictly about fitness.  He incorporates mindset, nutrition, and fitness into his personal health/lifestyle coaching philosophy.  During his time at the athletic club, he built up some clients who fell in love with his approach. 

Missing his family and friends back in Brazil, he decided to return, not quite certain where he would eventually end up. Marcelo stayed in Brazil for one year, worked with some very high end clients in Rio, and then moved back to San Diego with a three year plan to open his own facility.  Upon his arrival back, he got a job at La Jolla Sporting Club, and started working as a personal trainer.  

At that time, he was conducting his sessions at the gym and paying to use the facilities.  The gym recently asked for a higher percentage of his total take, so he has decided to move out to become his own boss. He now rents a small studio where he sees two clients.  He also travels to his other client's homes and conducts his classes there.  

Now that Marcelo is transitioning away from the gym, he needs support in buying some basic equipment and to help with renting his space.  He is also going to invest in his education by taking some more personal training classes. 

“I love this profession and I love this lifestyle,” says Marcelo. “Being able to transform my client's way of thinking is one of the most rewarding experiences in my life. I am so blessed.”

loans.use: to buy some basic equipment and to help with renting his space

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new equipment and supplies for his janitorial business.

loans.name: Dim's Group

texts.en: Dim’s group members live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Dim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en: Vy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chinna

texts.en:
Chinna is a twenty-year-old orphan and a freshman who is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in management. He lives with his brother and sister in the Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. His brother works in a microfinance and his sister works in a factory in the city. 

Chinna is lacking the finances to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, so he would like to request a loan. With the loan, he will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully, and gain the skills he needs to build his future. After graduation, Chinna hopes to work in a microfinance institution or a bank with a decent salary, so he will be able to save money to pursue a bachelor’s degree and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es una persona que esta esforzándose para poder crecer y salir adelante. Su sueño siempre fue ayudar a las personas, es por eso que estudia la carrera de trabajadora social.
Comenta que le gustaría poder trabajar en una organización grande, de manera a poder ser útil a la sociedad.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Ignacio. She is a person who is striving to grow and move forward. Her dream has always been to help people, which is why she is studying for a degree in Social Work.

Maria says that she enjoys working in a large organization, which allows her to be useful to society. She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her degree fees. This will enable her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fatima, es un grupo de jóvenes que se unieron para poder sentirse útiles y ayudar a sus familias por medio de una actividad que ellos mismos emprenden.
Vianca integra este grupo, ella emprende la venta de bijouteries varios, y por medio de esto tiene un ingreso con el cual ayuda a su familia y se siente útil. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bijouterie, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo luchando por crecer. 
Las personas extras en la foto son madres de los jóvenes que firman como codeudores para poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group called “Virgen de Fatima” is a group of young people that came together so that they could feel useful and help their families through work that they started themselves.

Vianca is part of this group. She started a business selling different types of jewelry. Through this, she has an income with which she helps her family and feels useful. She asks for this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of different jewelry. In this way, she can continue with her work fighting to grow.

The other people in the photo are mothers of the young people who are co-signers to the loan so that they can help their children.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este comité se unieron para poder trabajar y por medio de ese trabajo unido poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus familias y demás seres queridos.
La señora Maria es una de las integrantes del  comité, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que vende de manera ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio ha ido abriéndose camino con su trabajo.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para poder venderlos y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes
texts.en:
The 18 members of this committee came together in order to be able to work and by means of this united work to be able to help one another.  They are female heads of household who struggle for their families and other loved ones.
Maria is one of the members of the committee.  She makes a living selling various articles of clothing which she sells as a street vendor.  She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who with much sacrifice has been able to clear the way for her work.
Maria is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of various articles of clothing in order to be able to sell them and in this way be able to comply with the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Kimanye Group

texts.en:
Maimuna was born 1978. She is not married and has 2 children who are attending school. She is both a mother and father to her family, making sure all of their needs are met. 

In order to be able to support her family well, Maimuna opened a business selling livestock, wherein she buys goats and resells them at the livestock market. She has been in this business for 4 years. To grow her income, Maimuna added another business selling charcoal. She is a very hardworking mother, dreaming of selling more animals in the future such as cows. 

Maimuna wakes up early every morning, putting her house in order before getting to her business issues. She goes to the market to sell her goats at 6:00 am, working at her business until 7:00 pm. She is able to make a fair profit each month.

This is her first credit borrowed from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share this group loan with her 9 other group members from Kimanye Group. The group members will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

Maimuna will use her loan portion to buy goats which she will resell at the livestock market.

loans.use: to buy goats to resell at the livestock market.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
KHADIJA, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two kids, a boy and a girl, who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for five years now.  She works from 06am to 4.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be KHADIJA's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chairs and to increase the food stock, so she can now serve more customers. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, to build her house and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy a freezer and restock the out-of- stock items in her food store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

KHADIJA will make sure she pays back the loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and restock the out-of-stock items in her food store.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
NAJMA, who is in her early thirties, is married with three children who are still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for two years now.  She works from from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be NAJMA's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to improve on her salon by painting and putting up-to-date salon products.  She is doing great and thanks Kiva for their support.  She used the profit for paying school fees and household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon product and meet her customers' requests.  She dreams of owning a food shop. 

NAJMA will share this loan with her loan group, "Ulezi," which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' requests.

loans.name: Maritza Manuela

texts.es:
EL Grupo Crédito San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.
En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 6  años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Maritza realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él compra y vende chanchos, vacas, gallinas entre otros animales, el comprar los animales  en el campo y luego los vende en Santa Ana o Portoviejo. Así saca adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar gallinas, chanchos¡ y vacas para la venta. Esta desde el inicio en el  Grupo Crédito y le gusta porque así ayuda a su marido. Sus sueños son comprar un camión y ver crecer a su negocio.
texts.en:
San Pedro de Pueblo Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Pueblo Nuevo Parish in Santa Ana Canton, which has beautiful rural landscapes.  The people there are honest and friendly, and they earn a living in farming and ranching.

Maritza, 31, lives there.  She's in a common-law marriage and has a six-year-old son who attends school.  Her husband's a merchant.

Maritza takes this loan for her husband to use for his business. Her husband buys and sells pigs , cows , chickens and other animals. He goes and buys the animals in the country and then sells them in the cities of Santa Ana or Portoviejo. This brings income for his family.

This credit will be used specifically to buy chickens and cows to sell. Since the beginning of this Credit Group Maritza has liked it because it helps support her husband. Their dreams are to buy a truck to transport animals and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, and cows

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is fifty-one years old, single and manages a hog-raising business. She is raising hogs to sell as the main source of her income. She is now asking a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccines and medicine for her hogs. With the help of her loan, she will continuously give good nutrition to the hogs and will sell them at a higher price someday.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicine for hogs

loans.name: Carmen Janeth

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Confraternidad de Amigas. Este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este cantón  los lugareños preparan  deliciosos dulces que y que son reconocidos en la provincia y todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora  Carmen, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años, ambos estudian en escuela. El marido es mecánico automotriz.
Doña Carmen es una gran ama de casa que además  se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres en un local el cual arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí ella vende todo tipo de productos como víveres, helados legumbres, frutas, también vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo cuando tiene tiempo libre,  allí ella pasa todo el día pero siempre atenta a las necesidades de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, ropa perfumes, cremas y otros productos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son que su local sea propio. 
El bebé de la foto es hijo de una amiga suya.
texts.en:
The Confraternidad de amigas group loan meet every 15 days in the canton of Rocafuerte. This place is known for its nice and hardworking people.

In this district, the locals make delicious sweets that are recognized in the province and along the country. 

Carmen lives here. She is 30 years old and she is in a common law relationship, and she has two children, who are 10 and 5 years old. They both attend school.

Her husband is an auto mechanic. Carmen is a great housewife, and she also has a business. She has a grocery store in a  shop she rents in downtown. She sells all kind of products such as groceries, ice cream, legumes, fruits, she also sells all kind of clothes and products from Esika (beauty products, perfumes, and women accessories). She works every day from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. and sometimes even later.

Her husband helps her when he has some spare time. She spends her days there, but she is always caring for her children's needs.
The baby in the photo is the son of Carmen's friend.

She is going to use the credit to buy more supplies for her store. She'll buy rice, sugar, clothes, perfumes, lotions, and other products.

She is being part of the Group Loan since the beginning. She likes it because it allows her to finance her business. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, clothes, perfumes, lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is thirty-eight years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Elizabeth has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for five years. Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is fifty-seven years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Emma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices and oil for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Emma has been in this business for seven years. She would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices and oil

loans.name: Edelwina

texts.en:
Edelwina is 33 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Edelwina works very hard to provide for them.

Edelwina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, rice, feeds, noodles, snack foods, beer, etc., to sell.

Edelwina has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, rice, feeds, noodles, snack foods, beer, etc.

In the future, Edelwina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, rice, feeds, noodles, snack foods, beer, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is forty-eight years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marjorie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

Marjorie has been in this business for twenty-eight years. In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 58 years old. She is a widow woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Purita has a black smith business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her blacksmith business.

Purita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Purita would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Vircentina

texts.en:
Vircentina works hard to support her family. Vircentina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vircentina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vircentina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Vircentina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is forty-seven years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Judith has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Judith has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Deberlita

texts.en:
Deberlita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Deberlita is thirty-eight years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Deberlita has a handicrafts business in the Philippines. Deberlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells and wires for her business.

Deberlita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Deberlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells and wires for her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 3 children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

Melanie has a car wash business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running her general store. She is borrowing a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase new equipment for her car wash business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her car wash.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school and are under her care. They live at a rented house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanarusi operates a clothes-selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by the seasons. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is 38 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Ma. Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

Ma. Ruby has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, sanitary pads, noodles, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Ma. Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

Emily has been farming rice for 10 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Ma. Loreta

texts.en:
Ma. Loreta is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Loreta is 46 years old and her three children are in school.

Ma. Loreta has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines. Ma. Loreta requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear items, like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers.

Ma. Loreta has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money that so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear items like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 70 years old and a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susan has a grocery store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Adelfa

texts.en:
Ma. Adelfa is 56 years old and is married with 7 children. With 3 children in school, Ma. Adelfa works very hard to provide for all of them.

Ma. Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Adelfa has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Adelfa would like to save enough money to both expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elsa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.
She has been in this business for 9 years now.

Elsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ledys Maria

texts.es:
Ledys es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 48 años de edad trabaja incasablemente todos los días de la semana de lunes a domingo en su negocio de producción de alimentos típicos como tamales y chorizos. 

Madre de 3 hijos que depende totalmente de ella ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito como Interactuar para mejorar su negocio y soñar con su negocio de producción de alimentos y hacerle creer que es posible alcanzar este sueño. 

Solicita un crédito para la adecuación de su negocio y para la reparación de su congelador. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Ledys producirá mas alimentos y le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cada día darle mejores oportunidades de vida a sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Ledys, 48, is very committed to her job.  She works tirelessly every day of the week, from Monday through Sunday, in her business making traditional dishes like tamales and chorizo.  She's the mother of three children who depend entirely on her.

She sees Interactuar as an entity that gives her the confidence to have a loan to improve her business and makes it possible for her to realize her dream of having a business preparing food.

She's requesting a loan to fix up her business and repair her refrigerator.

Ledys will make more food with the help of this loan.  It will allow her to earn a better income so she can give her three children better opportunities in life every day.

loans.use: to fix up her business and repair her refrigerator

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es:
Con poco capital pero muchas ganas, la señora Luz ha logrado conformar un muy agradable y lindo salón de belleza que ha significado el sustento de su familia que la conforman dos hijos adolescentes.
Y que ahora por falta de capital ha frenado su progreso, el cuidado del pelo y de las uñas ha sido una actividad que ha ido en ascenso por lo que necesita un crédito para abastecer su negocio y el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido de tinturas, productos cosméticos y algunas mejoras para el baño y el local como lo son la señalización
texts.en:
With little capital, yet a lot of luck and hard work, Luz has been able to develop a very nice and attractive beauty salon. It has been of significant support to her family which includes to adolescent children.

Now her progress has been halted due to a lack of capital. Hair and nail care has been a growing business which is why she needs a loan to supply her business. She will invest in the purchase of supplies like dyes, cosmetic products, and some improvements for her bathroom and the storefront, such as signage.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetic products, carry out improvements to her bathroom, and purchase signage.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre muy experimentado en el área de comercialización de animales, pero no cuenta con el capital para iniciar su propio negocio y esto hace que se llene de miedo e inseguridad.

Hoy en día, gracias a la corporación interactuar, intentara salir adelante con el montaje de un negocio de comercialización de carne; su gran motivación son sus dos hijos y su esposa que siempre lo apoyan en sus proyectos.
Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de marranos para revenderlos y así obtener ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
De esta forma su vida cambiara y tendrá un mejor sustento.

Ayuda a Carlos a salir adelante con un préstamo Hoy!
texts.en:
Carlos is a very experienced man in the field of selling animals, but he doesn't have the capital to start his own business and this results in fear and insecurity for him.  Today, thanks to the partner Interactuar, he is trying to move forward with the launch of a business selling meat.  His biggest motivation are his two children and his wife, who always support his endeavors.  Carlos is asking for financial support to purchase pigs so that he can resell them and gain income to support his family.  As a result, his life will change and he will have a better livelihood. 

Help Carlos to progress forward with a loan today!

loans.use: to purchase pigs so that he can resell them.

loans.name: Sawabu

texts.en:
Sawabu is a divorced woman living with her eight children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 30 years, she has operated a firewood selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alexandra Marcela

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Alexandra es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
Ella prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
Su esposo e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
Trabaja sola durante 6 horas todos los días.
Ella espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima pan, queso, jamon, entre otros, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
Con estos elementos ella podrá tener sus alimentos disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Alexandra's courage and perseverance, people in her home can have a decent life. She makes and sells fast food in the municipality of Medellín, a business she started in an effort to look for new income to support her family. Her husband and children are the greatest motivation she has for working daily and striving to make every day better.

She works alone for 6 hours everyday. She hopes to be able to boost her business by purchasing ingredients like bread, ham, cheese as well as other products. The Corporación Interactuar and Kiva lenders can give her this boost.

With these things, she will be able to have food available for her customers at all times. Her greatest dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area in order not to lose her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as ham, cheese and bread for her food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase carpentry materials, cement, and bricks to build an extra room for the house.

loans.name: Aman

texts.ru: Аман, 34 года, женат, отец 3 детей школьников. У Амана среднее образование, на протяжении 9 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Амана есть 2 лошади, 3 коров, 5 овец, также 4,20 ГА поливной земли, на которой он выращивает ячмень и клевер. Дополнительно на ежедневной основе реализует молоко. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Аман обратился в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Аман планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Aman is 34 years old, married and has three children of  preschool age. He has received secondary education. For nine years he has been growing farm produce and growing livestock. At present Aman’s farm includes two horses, three cows, and five sheep; he also has 4.2 ha [10 acres] of arable land, where he grows barley and clover. In addition, he sells milk on a daily basis. In order to develop his business further, Aman has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep for fattening and resale. Aman plans to use his revenues for an additional increase of livestock; in the future he also plans to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Uracan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras que son: Dionicia, Florencia y Kenia Irene; viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace un año con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana, para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Con el primer préstamo que recibieron de Kiva lograron: Dionicia incrementó los productos que vende y diversificó sus ventas incorporando una pequeña pulpería y venta de bastimento. Florencia pudo comprar telas para confeccionar vestidos y otros encargos que le hicieron para promoción escolar. Kenia logró comprar un poco de ropa nueva, que añadió en su tramo de ropa de usada.  Están muy entusiasmadas por los beneficios que obtienen con el crédito.  

Dionicia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, es una joven luchadora, amable, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos: El mayor de 8 años de edad, estudia su segundo grado de primaria y un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Con los ingresos del salario de su esposo no cubren todas las necesidades básicas del hogar, por lo que ella buscó la forma de apoyar con los gastos en el hogar, educación de su hijo y tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 2 años vende productos plásticos para el hogar en un tramo en el mercado municipal. Solicita su financiamiento para comprar más productos en Managua: Panas, trastes, baldes, tinas, entre otros productos, diversificar sus productos al ofertar vestidos nuevos para niñas y venderlos a precios accesibles en la ciudad de Bilwi. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto, ya que es de mayor durabilidad.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 enterprising women: Dionicia, Florencia,  and Kenia Irene. They live in the city of Bilwi. They came together a year ago with the purpose of working in a united manner to have access to a loan from Pana Pana so that they could have the opportunity to improve their small businesses, increase their earnings and in that way improve the quality of life for their families. 

With the first loan they received from Kiva they were able to: Dionicia increased the products she sells and she diversified her sales by adding a small grocery store and the sale of staple items.  Florencia was able to buy fabrics to make dresses and other items that were ordered to promote schooling. Kenia was able to buy new clothes which she added to her stall of used clothing. They are very excited with the benefits that they obtained through the loan.

Dionicia is the coordinator for the solidarity group; she is polite, with the qualities of a leader, young, tenacious and friendly. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. Her oldest is 8 years old and is in the second grade in primary school and her youngest is 2 years old.
 
They can’t cover the basic needs of the house with her husband’s income, which is she looked for a way to help with the household expenses, her son’s education and to have her own source of income. For 2 years she has sold household plastic products at a stall in the municipality’s market.  

She is requesting this loan to buy more products in Managua: trays, plates, buckets, and containers, amongst other products. She will diversify her products by selling new dresses for girls at reasonable prices for the city of Bilwi. Her dream is to build her house out of concrete since it has longer durability.

loans.use: to buy in Managua: trays, plates, buckets, and containers, amongst other products, and diversify her products by selling new dresses for girls

loans.name: Sokhbol's Group

texts.en: Sokhbol’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sokhbol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling groceries to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nhor Group

texts.en:
Nhor is a 46-year old married rice farmer with three children. She lives in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. She has cultivated rice since 1989. Her husband is 45 years old and works on a yam plantation. Two of Nhor's children work with their father; the youngest one attends school. Together, the family earns around USD $22 a day.

Nhor also leads a four-member group that is requesting a loan. She will use her portion to buy construction materials for a latrine. With the latrine, Nhor and her family can improve their standard of hygiene. 

In the future, Nhor wants to buy farmland to cultivate yams for sale, and renovate her house. She also wants to support her child's effort to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy materials for a latrine.

loans.name: Analeah

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Analeah works hard to support her family.

She has a business, in the Philippines, of buying and selling young coconuts. She also earns additional income from fishing and pig fattening. Analeah is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy additional young coconuts to sell for her buying and selling business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Analeah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional young coconut to sell for her business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesusa is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jesusa has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, shewould like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 29 years old and married with one kid in school.

Jovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jovelyn has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jovelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and married with six children. Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

Elsie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, detergent soap, sugar, milk, juice, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc. 

Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 28 years old and she earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

Josephine has been raising goats for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming corn. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her goats.

loans.name: Vhina

texts.en:
Vhina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business of buying and selling vegetables, in the Philippines.

Vhina has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business. She has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Vhina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

loans.name: Boston Elshadai Dev't  Makindye Group

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman with three children. She is a repeat client with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd., having taken and repaid her previous loans very well.

Maureen is a business woman, owning a salon. In a bid to improve on the state of her family and to expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of 1000,000UGX, through the group. She would like to buy a hair drier, relaxers and weaves to boost the salon business. She is, however, faced with the challenge of limited capital to add to and boost her business.

Maureen is very grateful for the financial support from both Ugafode Microfinance and kiva funders and she and the group members are pledging to perform well so that they can continue benefiting from the service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Fozia  Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
Fozia Al-Waytat is a group which consists of four members of women, living in Sana'a city, Yemen. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

All the members of the group chose Fozia as the leader of their group. She is a 27 years old married woman. She and her husband have their five children living with them in a small house which consists of just two rooms, one bath, as well as one a small kitchen. The income of Fozia's husband is not enough to make the necessary expandions to the home and she works as a housewife. 

In order to make some of the necessary improvements for the house, Fozia has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase some of the construction supplies to make extra rooms. They are hoping to make enough expansions for the house.

Fozia looks forward to purchasing enough doors and windows for the rooms which she will build.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary construction supplies to make extra rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 20 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 5 años a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de ganado bovino, siembra las dos épocas del año verano e invierno, y ganado pasta todo el año, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plaga, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y poder generar mejores ingresos para el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
This young man has a pixelated face because he is 20 years old and lives in a high-risk area. For 5 years, he has made a living growing corn and raising cattle. He grows in both summer and winter, and his cattle graze all year long. This young man lives in his own house with his life partner. 

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc. as shown in the photograph, to be able to continue working and earn more income to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de ganado bovino y a la siembra de granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado bovino para seguir con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan is 33 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. For the past 3 years, he has made a living raising cattle and growing basic grains. He sells his products in neighboring towns.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to continue raising them and as a result, earn more income.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Isolina Del Rosario

texts.es:
Isolina del Rosario tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, vive en el distrito de Morropón, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas, actividad que realiza hace más de 03 años, contando con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para posteriormente engordarlo y vender la carne, de esta manera Isolina espera incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isolina del Rosario is 48 years old and is single.  She lives in the Morropon district, a place where the residents work in agriculture, livestock production, and trade.  Her house has basic utilities including water and electricity, and is located in  Morropon province in the Piura region of the northern coast of Peru.

Isolina has a business selling red meat.  She's had this business for more than 3 years, and now has regular customers who provide very good work and personal references for her.  Isolina is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of cattle to fatten so she can sell their meat.  In this way, she hopes to increase her income and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell seaweed business in the Philippines. Celina has been in this business for 1 year and earns income from this and from buying and selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy additional seaweed to sell from her buy and sell seaweed business.


Celina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional seaweed to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, two of whom are in school, Betty works hard to support her family.  She has a farming rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. 

Betty is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and has now requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 56 years old and widowed with one child.  She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines.  She has been farming coconuts for 1 year and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and dried coconut meat.

Mercidita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.


She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosebilla

texts.en:
Rosebilla is 51 years old and married with five children.   She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She works hard to provide for her family and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell at her general store.

Rosebilla has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Myrna has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from farming rice and fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman and has been blessed with four children. Three of her children attend school while the other one is still too young for school. Together with her children, she lives at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. 

Mwanasha has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability, leading to losses.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Doña Ofelia de 51 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura la siembra y cultivo de café es un rubro provechoso para ella y su familia pues este trae muchas ventajas al momento de la recolección del grano para su venta. Ella tiene un grado de estudio realizado de primaria la cual completo con mucha satisfacción, se encuentra casada y junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de. De su matrimonio procrearon 10 hijos pero con ella y su esposo únicamente 3 viven en su casa, 2 están estudiando en el instituto de la comunidad y apoyan a su padre en las diferentes labores que a diario se realizan en el campo, una hija la cual recién está criando. Doña Ofelia cuenta con un pequeño negocio de pulperia en el cual colaboran sus tres hijos y ayudan con los quehaceres en el mismo y en el hogar. La propiedad fue herencia de sus padres involucrándose únicamente la familia en el mantenimiento y cuidado de la misma. Sus planes mejorar su negocio de pulperia, así como implementar un molino para moler maíz y facilitarle a los vecinos y demás habitantes un servicio más el cual también ayude a mejorar la economía en el hogar y de la misma manera seguir ampliando su propiedad y sembrar más café. Doña Ofelia solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para asistir la propiedad pues ella dice quiere aprovechar que ya comenzó el invierno para que la propiedad produzcan un buen grano y obtener una magnifica cosecha y si Dios quiere obtener buenas ganancias mejorando las condiciones de vida y demás necesidades.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 51 years old and makes a living at agriculture and cultivating coffee. It is a rewarding area of work for her and her family because it brings many advantages at the time of harvesting grains for sale. She has a degree in elementary studies that she completed with much satisfaction. She is married and together with her husband they work in farming. They have had 10 children but only three live at home, one of which is a recently born daughter.  Two children are studying in a local college and then help their father in the various work done daily in the field.

Ofelia has a small grocery store business in which she works with three children and they help with chores there and at home. The property was inherited from her parents and the family is engaged in the maintenance and care of it. Her plans include improving her grocery store business and implementing a mill to grind corn. This will make things easier for other locals, giving them access to this service, and also will help to improve the family finances and allow her to further expand her property and plant more coffee.

Ofelia is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL for the purchase of fertilizers to use on her property. She wants to take advantage of the land now so that the property can produce a good grain harvest. With a good harvest, God willing, she can obtain good profits, improve her living conditions, and attend to other needs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay for labor to assist her in the cultivation of coffee.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad se dedica desde hace 30 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijoles y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía, para comercializar sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old, and he has made a living in agriculture growing corn, beans, and millet for 30 years. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph, in order to sell his product in the various markets close to his home.

Jose lives with his wife in their own house. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, etc. to be able to continue with his work and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee desde hace 10 años un cibercafé ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de papelería, tintas y darle mantenimiento a las computadoras, y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

For 10 years, he has owned an internet café located near his home, in a very busy area. This young man has his own home where he lives with his wife and daughter.

He is requesting a loan to pay for paper products, ink, and the maintenance of his computers, and as a result, be able to continue with his work and earn a better income.

loans.use: to pay for paper products, ink, and the maintenance of his computers.

loans.name: Ngambawm Group

texts.en:
Vincy is a 22-year-old young lady from the hills of the northeastern region of India. She lives with her younger siblings and her mother. Vincy is the profiled member of the group and was photographed with her hand raised. She is an amiable person whose timeless effort goes for the benefit of the family. Her mother and Vincy work in their own stream to make a living. They live in a community where most people engage in weaving and daily wage as their main occupation. Vincy took tailoring training from an expert in her neighbourhood. She has been sewing under the supervision of the expert for the last two years and wishes to start a tailoring business on her own at her home. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine for herself to start the tailoring business. She sews different types of clothes like tops, skirts, and pants. The income derived from her tailoring will help with the family maintenance exclusively. She will now be independently earning on her own. All the group members are hard
working and strive for financial betterment through the loan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Julissa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Julissa Del Pilar tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. De esta manera Julissa Del Pilar espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julissa Del Pilar is 29 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives with her family in the district of Cayaltí. The people there make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. This district is located in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.

She has made a living raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens, and turkeys for 10 years. She runs her business out of her home. She has business experience and very good personal and professional recommendations in the area.

She has requested a loan to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys among others, as well as to buy nutritional food for them. With this, Julissa Del Pilar hopes to offer a larger variety of animals to her customers, for which she will earn a better income and be able to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys among others, as well as to buy nutritional food for them.

loans.name: Alen

texts.en:
Alen is 34 years old, and lives with his lovely family in Vanadzor in the Lori region. He is married, and has two school-aged boys.  Alen has no higher education, but over the years he has become a very experienced and good driver. Now he works as a taxi driver, and he drives his own car. Alen says that the thing he likes most about his work is that nearly every day he manages to meet and speak with his old friends and relatives. Alen takes no holidays and works very late, since his job is the only one that supports his family. He says he has no lack of customers, since he likes to drive carefully and attentively. For him it is more important to drive safely than to drive quickly.
 
Alen had asked for this loan to repair the engine of his car. These repairs will also help him to reduce the expenses of diesel fuel, which means significant savings each month.

loans.use: to repair the engine of his car, which will also to help reduce the expenses of diesel fuel for his car

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Doritas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive don Victor, tiene 40 años de edad, mantienen una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El señor Victor es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para vivir, el es albañil y trabaja de forma independiente, pero también en su casa tiene una pequeña granja en la cual con la ayuda de sus mujer crían chanchos y pollos, ella compra chanchos y pollos cuando están pequeños, los mantiene por un tiempo adecuado y luego los vende a los comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar a comprar estos animalitos para llevarlos de otras ciudades, de esta forma ellos sale adelante ya que en ocasiones el trabajo de construcción se termina y no puede trabajar.
Este crédito es para comprar dos chanchos y alimento para los chanchos y pollos.  Lleva 2 años en el Grupo Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener salud y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Las Doritas lending group meets every two weeks in the City of Carmen.  This is known as a very dynamic area where most of the residents farm and raise animals.  It’s an area of much vegetation.

Victor lives here.  He is 40 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children, ages 16 and 13, who addend school.  His wife is a homemaker.

Victor is a very hardworking man who does whatever her can so that his family is not in need of anything.  He is a mason and works on his own, but he also has a small farm at his home and he and his wife raise pigs and chickens.  She buys them when they are small and sells them to merchants who come to buy them and take them to other towns.  He gets ahead in this manner because the construction work ends at times and he can’t work. 

He will use this loan to buy two pigs and feed for the pigs and chickens.  He has been with the lending group for two years and he likes the help from the loans.  He hopes to be able to provide the best for his family and for them to be healthy.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 39 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising cattle in the Philippines.  Lorelie has been raising cattle for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
   
Lorelie has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to replace her in the photo. She is 49 years old, and she has three sons. Her husband is a retired man and working now as a building contractor. Khawla needs a loan to help her husband to buy new construction equipment, which will assist him in his work. She is wishing to have their own office to enhance the family income.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment, which will assist her husband to enhance the family income.

loans.name: Maicel

texts.en:
Maicel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Maicel has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 31 years old and married with two children who go to school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maribeth has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, coffee, cereals, etc.  In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is an ambitious, 37-year-old lady. Warda has started her own small project selling household tools in her home. She wants to open her special shop and emphasize her small business to sell goods, gifts and stationery to people living in her sub area.  Her project has enhanced her economic situation in a great way, and now she is seeking a loan to open a shop and enhance it more, and to support herself and her family. 

Warda's dream is not stoppable.  In the future, she also wishes also to make a special department for sewing and hand-made and handicrafts goods. Because there is no one responsible for her expenditures, she has a mass need to secure her future.

loans.use: to open her special small shop and emphasize her small business.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a divorced mother of two children. One of her children attends school, while the other one is still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open-air business selling food from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is the group leader of her group in Kakamega North District, and she is representing six farmers, including herself. She is married and a proud mother of four children. Magret joined One Acre Fund for the first time this season, but she has been a farmer for 10 years.

Like many other farmers, Magret decided to work with One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She hopes that by joining One Acre Fund and using the seeds and fertilizer she will get with this loan, she can join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the profits she earns from this year’s harvest to invest in a business.

Magret's Group will use the farming inputs received with this loan to cultivate a total of 3.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights, as, even though Magret decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Om Yousef Al- Radhi Group

texts.en:
These four enterprising women belong to Om Yousef Al- Radhi Group, who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They are seeking a loan of 170,000 YER from AMB for improve the living conditions of their families.

One of the group members is Hayila, who is a 40-year-old married woman, and a mother of four children, living with her family in a very humble house. Hayila is the leader of the group.  The house where she lives lacks of a lot of furniture, and the founded furniture is very old and needs to change. Hayila and her family feel inconvenienced and the income of the father is not enough to do what they must do to improve the living condition inside the house. 

As a result, Hayila turned to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank and took out a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new beds and furniture for the house.
