In this bad condition in which she lives with her children, Hayila hopes to open her own business as a small grocery to provide her family with a better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new beds and furniture for the house.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona is a 35-year-old, married woman and a mother of four children, from Mundri.  She runs a small business selling various goods to the people in her community. She has been in the business for one year. She is requesting a loan of 1,700 SSP to by more inventory of sugar, and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy more new goods for the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en una zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de ropa interior, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres y su hermana, ella esta solicitando por tercera vez un crédito para poder mas comprar ropa interior para damas y caballeros por mayor,  ya que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y ha tenido muy buenas ganancias en los últimos meses por esa razón desea seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman has had her face blurred because she is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She lives in her own home with her parents and her sister.  

She has been selling underwear for three years.  She is asking for a loan for the third time in order to be able to buy women’s and men’s underwear in bulk, because things have gone really well for her in her business and she has had good earnings in the past few months.  Because of that, she wants to keep going with her sales in order to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's underwear in bulk

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nilda has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, Nilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is married and works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years now. 

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional peanuts and other ingredients.

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional peanuts and other ingredients

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

Sheryl has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Sheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money so that she can send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Melva works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Melva is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jacklyne's Group

texts.en:
Jackline is 40 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for 18 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Jackline is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jackline started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Jackline’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 56 years old and married. She has eight children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines.

Marilyn has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and to pay for laborers' salaries.

She has been farming rice for 11 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 13 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for laborers' salaries

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Ramón vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado para seguir  con la crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ramón lives in his own home with his son; he has been raising cattle for the last four years; he sells his animals in the outskirts of the area where he lives; he is able to get ahead with his earnings.  He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to continue with his business and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia, con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de ganado y al cultivo de granos básicos, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya tiene clientes fijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de engorde para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Antonio is 45 and lives in his own home with his wife and two children.  For several years now he has been raising cattle and growing staple grains; he sells his produce in the outskirts of the area where he lives and he has steady customers.  He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten so he can continue with his work and make better profits.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jessica Marilin

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carmen cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Doritas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 21 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 2 hijos de 2 años el mayor y un bebé de 5 meses. Su marido trabaja en una gasolinera en la localidad.
Doña Jessica es una gran ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños hace  varios años con la ayuda de su marido construyó un corral en el cual cría aves de corral y  chanchos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando están pequeños, los alimenta por espacio de tres a cuatro meses y cuando tienen un peso adecuado los vende a muchos comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos los mismos que al venderlos le dejan muy buenas ganancias	que le permiten salir adelante ya que los gastos son muchos y con lo que gana el marido no alcanza.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos  y pollos. Lleva casi  año y medio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la rapidez con que llegan los créditos. Sus sueños darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Las Doritas Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Carmen; this place is known for being very dynamic, with the majority of its residents working in farming and livestock, as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.  

This is where Jessica lives; she is 21 years old and in a relationship that has produced two children, who are a two-year-old and a five-month-old baby.  Her partner works at a gas station in the neighborhood.  

Jessica is a great stay-at-home mom who built a corral where she raises poultry and pigs so she can earn something on her own and help her husband with the household expenses while raising their children.  She buys her animals when they are young, feeds them for three to four months, and when they are heavy enough she sells them to many dealers who come to her house to buy her animals.  Selling them provides her with very good earnings, which allow them to get ahead as they have many expenses and her husband's pay is not enough.  

This loan is to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and chickens.  She has been in her credit group for almost a year and a half and she likes it because the loans arrive quickly.  Her dreams are to give her little ones the best.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 20 years old. He is an athletic man and loves all kinds of sports, so he chose to specialize in this field and study toward a sports-related major in the university. He wishes to get a loan to pay his tuition fees and continue on his lovely path. Maybe he will become an athlete on the National Team.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees and continue on his lovely path

loans.name: Lawrent's Group

texts.en:
Lawrent is 52 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader, and he is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Lawrent has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Lawrent also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Lawrent's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Janet, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 40 years old, and as a group leader, she is representing her group of 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has four children.

Janet is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to earn enough to feed her family, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Janet says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Janet will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old, married and has two children, one of whom in school.  She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marites has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is an 18-year-old single young man who started working in a restaurant three years ago to cover his needs and expenses and to help his poor family.

Hadi is a hard worker and an ambitious man who is continuing his studies without his job being affected. Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his university tuition fees because his salary is no longer adequate to cover the increasing costs of living.

Hadi hopes to finish his studies and open his own business to increase his income and stay capable of providing for his family's needs.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Sorphea

texts.en:
Sorphea lives in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. He is a 22-year-old freshman who is studying English literature at an institute in the province. Sorphea has also worked for a company as a product seller since 2013, earning around USD 5 each day.

He is requesting a loan and he will use it to pay his first-year tuition fees. This loan will enable him to go through the first year successfully. In the future, he hopes to have a better job with a decent salary.

loans.use: to pay his first-year tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Jilmer

texts.es:
Jilmer tiene 34 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y dos hijos menores de edad. Vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Esta es una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, su vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café variedad catimore, realiza esta actividad en terreno propio, tiene 08 años de experiencia en este sector y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto Jilmer espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jilmer is 34 years old; he has a stable home with his partner and their two young children.  He lives in his own home made of rustic materials in the rural area of the district of Santo Tomás, which is in Cutervo Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains.  This is a small community basically dedicated to farming and ranching.  His home has water and electricity.  

He works in farming, specifically growing the Catimor variety of coffee.  He does this work on his own land; he has eight years of experience in this field and he has very good personal and work references in the area.  Additionally, he also raises and sells cattle.  This loan will be used to buy manure and fertilizers to treat his coffee crop; with this Jilmer hopes to offer his customers a better quality coffee, which will have a great impact on his earnings and will thereby improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to treat his coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten and then sell at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes at discounted prices to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Las Cruces No. 1 Group

texts.es:
Reina es una señorita de tan solo 24 años de edad, ella vive en una comunidad de San Antonio junto a sus padres y hermanos. 
Reina( es la señora que esta de ultimo o al lado derecho de la fila de atrás) es una mujer soltera, por ser una mujer sin compromisos ella está en toda la disponibilidad de trabajar en beneficio de su familia, Reina con el apoyo de sus padres y hermanos, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz, es un oficio que le encanta hacer y le ayuda a generar sus ingresos y de esta forma ella apoya a sus padres en algunos gastos de la casa, el terreno donde cultiva reina está en la misma comunidad donde ella vive. 
 Reina vive en un lugar cálido por lo que les da opción a tener dos cosechas por año. Y eso les ayuda a generar más ingreso. Pues ella quiere sembrar un poco más pero con elcapital que tiene no es suficiente para hacer la nueva inversión, es por eso que ella está buscando un prestamo para comprar más semillas y fertilizantes para la nueva cosecha. Reina además de trabajar la tierra también en sus horas libres ella se dedica a la venta de lociones y esta es otra fuente de ingresos que ella tiene. Reina esta muy segura en conseguir su prestamo para la nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Reina is a young lady of only 24; she lives in the community of San Antonio together with her parents and her siblings.  

Reina (she is the last woman on the right side of the back row) is a single woman; because she is not engaged, she is free and completely available to work for her family.  Reina, with the help of her parents and her siblings, works growing corn; it is work that she loves to del and it helps her generate income so she can help her parents with some of the household expenses.  The land where Reina grows is in the same community where she lives.  

Reina lives in a warm area, so she has the option of having two crops per year.  This helps them generate more income.  She would like to plant a little more, but they do not have enough capital to make a new investment, which is why she is looking for a loan to buy more seed and fertilizers for a new crop.  Aside from work the land, Reina also sells lotions in her free time, which is another source of income that she has.  Reina is very sure of receiving her loan for her new crop.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en: Anvarjon is a famous and skillful master in the town of Konibodom. With his beautiful creations, he has won over all the residents of the city.  He is 40 years old and has been in this line of work for 7 years. Anvarjon likes his work very much. He makes windows and doors out of wood. He has 5 daughters and for their good future he wants to expand his business and improve his life. He wants to purchase a modern saw bench to simplify his work and save time. Anvarjon also builds houses, with the help of his brother. He hopes with a modern sawmill he'll develop his work and increase the family income. Your support is very important to Anvarjon.

loans.use: To buy a  modern saw bench

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la provincia de Cutervo que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros en su mototaxi (vehículo), tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad y cuenta con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Antenor espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antenor is 41 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and their 3 children in the province of Cutervo, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. He lives in a community where life is calm. The population works in agriculture, business, and livestock.

He offers urban transport services to passengers in his motortaxi. He has five years of experience in this work, and he has fixed clients who offer him very good personal and professional references. 

The loan will be used to make repairs and to maintain his vehicle, since it is now in a bad state. With this, Antenor hopes to offer better service to his clients, which will then be reflected in his level of income. This will allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to make repairs and to maintain his vehicle, which is now in a bad state.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, 44, is a smallholder farmer residing in Nyamira, an agricultural town in the Nyanza region of Kenya. He is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. Kale is Robert’s main produce. He sells more than 15 kgs of kale every day. Back in 2000, Robert practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. He was growing only half an acre of maize per season. The returns were so meager that he could barely fend for himself. He kept maize farming for years without turning a profit until 2008, when he switched to kale farming and dairy farming and there was light at the end of the tunnel for Robert. Today, Robert is a full-fledged entrepreneur. He has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. He has already serviced other asset-based loans fully from Juhudi Kilimo. To capitalize more on returns from the booming kale farming, Robert is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike his competition, Robert conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high-quality produce. By doing this, he has created a name for himself and a demand for his produce. Your support will contribute greatly to Robert achieving his goal, which is to expand the greenhouse. In the future, he is also planning to introduce the zero grazing method, intensify his kale farming, and start value addition.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Esta comunidad esta habitada por gente amable dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de lavado de autos, motos, camiones, etc. desde hace más de 02 años. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo será para la compra de aceite para motos y herramientas como mangueras, baldes, entre otros para implementar su negocio. Con esto Miguel Angel espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran inpacto en sus ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is 45 years old, single, and lives in his family home with his parents in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in the Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  This community is inhabited by kind people who work in farming, ranching, and commerce. 

He has been providing car, motorcycle, truck, etc. washing services for over two years.  He has experience in this business and he has steady customers who can offer very good personal and work references for him.  This loan will be to buy oil for motorcycles and tools, such as hoses and buckets, among other things, to use at his business.  With this, Miguel Angel hopes to offer his customers better service, which will have a huge impact on his income and which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil for motorcycles and tools, such as hoses and buckets, among other things, to use in his business

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region and she is a teacher with 35 years of work experience. Valya graduated from State University in the city of Tbilisi specializing in Russian language and literature. Now she lives with her son, who works as a computer operator.  Valya lectures at the Vanadzor State University. She enjoys her work greatly and during the examination periods she helps her students to get prepared properly to have high scores.
Valya is thankful and happy to have this Kiva loan of 500.000 Armenian drams, to buy a computer and professional literature. She greatly wants to have the latest new books to learn innovative methods in pedagogy.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature, to have the latest methodological books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, vegetables, meat and other ingredients needed

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en:
Abibu is aged 40 years and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy maize to sell. Still dealing in the produce business, he has managed to look after his dependents. He supplements his income with farming whereby he has had a banana plantation since 2008. 

He ventured into business with a major aim of earning a living. He faces a difficulty in the unpredictable weather changes, yet he dreams of having a fully stocked produce store and also having a healthy family. Abibu will use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, 32, is a father who has been running a small-scale mixed farm in Kenya for two years. His primary income sources are maize, vegetables, bananas, a job salary, and profits from a small personal business. 

Jackson is seeking a loan to purchase modern farming implements. He realized that he is working increasingly longer and harder on his farm. The work that men in the area are currently doing on the farms was previously women's tasks. They have been forced to take over as their wives migrate to find wage labour in urban areas. Therefore, the tools the men use are of great importance for improving productivity and yields and reducing time and physical effort. There are health implications as well in using poor traditional tools. 

The increased income from the use of better tools will help him meet business-related expenses. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Jackson replied, "I will be able to educate my children."

loans.use: To purchase farm implements

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay her for goods taken on credit. 

Mwanaisha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of 40,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives with her husband and three school-age daughters in Nor Kharberd village of the Ararat region. 
Mariam's husband works as a taxi driver using his own car and Mariam herself takes care of household. She runs a farm cultivating potatoes, greens and sunflowers. Near the house where they live, Mariam also owns a barn. She would like to expand her agricultural activities and start livestock breeding. For that reason, she asks for this loan of USD $500 to be able to purchase a cow. 
As this is Mariam's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya is a well educated 50-year-old woman - a mother of six sons. Her husband is a doctor. She wants to be a role model for her children. Her highest goal in life is to support her children and see them in the highest educational level in the society. Given the hard economic situation, she is seeking a loan to cover the study expenses for her daughter, who is studying pharmaceutics, which will let her continue her educational path. Raya wishes to see her family members in sustainable and secure situations in their jobs and homes.

loans.use: to cover her daughter's university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cacao for chocolate

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora, pictured above, is representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Flora will not only purchase maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Flora plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total, Flora’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvest season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 56 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than twenty years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming season

loans.name: Leonita's Group

texts.en:
Leonita's Group is formed by 13 farmers in the Kakamega North District and is being represented by Leonita, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 37 years old, is married and has 4 children. Leonita has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Leonita isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed - especially in the sense that she is healthier due to better nutrition. This year, Leonita will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Leonita's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras (Juana Elmaira, Myurel y Kenya), viven en Bilwi; se unieron hace un año, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, para mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida de sus familias.

Juana Elmaira: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, está casada, tiene dos hijos: El mayor de 6 años, estudia su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 2 años de edad. Su esposo cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años de ser conductor de taxi. Desde hace 6 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo de madera, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y contribuye con los gastos del hogar y en los estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar: granos básicos, chivería, pan, huevos, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en:
The group includes three enterprising women (Juana Elmaira, Myurel, and Kenya), and they live in Bilwi. They met a year ago with the goal of working together to access loan from Pana Pana and to have the opportunity to increase the inventories of their small businesses to improve their income and the quality of life of their families. 

Juana Elmaira is a member of this group. She is from Puerto Cabezas and is married with two children. Her older child is 6 years old and studies in first grade of primary school; her younger child is 2 years old. Her husband has four years of experience in driving a taxi. Six years ago, she started a small grocery store in the hallway of her home, which is made of wood. In this way, she earns her own income and contributes to the household expenses and son’s education. 

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, Chivería brand products, bread, eggs, and soda among other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and to build a house from concrete.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, Chivería brand products, bread, eggs, and soda among other products.

loans.name: Magnive

texts.es:
Magnive tiene 31 años de edad, es separada, vive con sus padres y su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado para damas y niños. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, pollos, patos, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio. Con esto Magnive espera ofrecer mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Magnive is 31, separated, and lives with her parents and her daughter in the district of Cayaltí, which is located in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  She lives in a community that works in commerce, farming, and ranching. 

She raises and sells animals such as chickens, ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs, among others.  Additionally, she sells clothing and shoes for women and children.  She has experience in this business and she has very good work and personal references in the area.  This loan will be used to buy a larger number of animals, such as chickens, roosters, and ducks, among others, to increase her business's stock. With this Magnive hopes to offer a wider variety of animals to her customers, which will allow her to increase her sales and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals, such as chickens, roosters, and ducks, among others, to increase her business's stock

loans.name: Perci Fernando

texts.es:
Perci Fernando tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar con sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable dedicada a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales, tónicos para el riñon, prostata, hígado, etc, y hierbas naturales como boldo, higasan, flor de hobero, que son hierbas tradicionales de la región. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos naturales y hierbas medicinales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto Perci Fernando espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que tendrá gran impacto en su nivel de ventas, mejorará sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Perci Fernando is 25 years old, single, and lives in his family home with his parents in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on Peru's northern coast.  He lives in a community of kind people who work in farming, ranching, and commerce. 

He sells medicinal products, tonics for the kidney, prostate, liver, etc., and natural herbs, such as boldo, higasan, and flor de hobero, which are traditional herbs found in this region.  He has experience in this business and steady customers who can offer very good personal and professional references for him.  This loan will be to buy a larger quantity of natural products and medicinal herbs to increase his business's stock.  With this Perci hopes to offer his customers a wider variety, which will have a huge impact on his sales and improve his income as well as his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of natural products and medicinal herbs to increase his business's stock

loans.name: Hope Savings Group

texts.en:
Joseph, with a raised hand, is a member of the Hope Savings Group. He is 29 years old and has two children. He also has three other dependents whom he takes care of and provides for their needs.

Joseph operates a retail shop. He is medical assistant at the Rubaga road clinic at Bakuli to earn additional income. He decided to take the group loan to  increase the working capital of his business by buying more stock of scholastic materials and other items such as biscuits, juice, and sugar. He faces challenges of competition from other shopkeepers and  limited capital.

loans.use: to purchase scholastic materials and other items such as biscuits, juice, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase the necessary construction materials to expand the house by build a new room.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
Jose Armando tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de su padre en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila, la población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una unidad móvil de su propiedad con la cual brinda este servicio. Cuenta con más de 04 años de experiencia en el rubro y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento de su vehículo que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Jose Armando espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le va a generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Armando is 39 years old, single, and lives in his parents' house in the district of Pucará, which is located in Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in Peru's northern mountains.  Life in this community is calm; its inhabitants work in farming, ranching, and commerce. 

He works in public transportation; he owns a vehicle that he uses to provide this service.  He has over four years of experience in the field and he has very good personal and professional references in the area.  This loan will be used to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in bad shape.  With this, Jose Armando hopes to offer his customers better service, which will generate more income and thereby improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in bad shape

loans.name: Jaclyne's Group

texts.en:
Jacklyne is 37 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for 16 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Jacklyne is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 5 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.

Jacklyne started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve - especially in the sense that she has been able to save more money. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Jacklyne’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 1 solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 47 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, Lina works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, noodles, cooking oil, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Lina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, noodles, cooking oil, toothpaste, etc.

In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like candies, biscuits, canned goods, beers, noodles, cooking oil, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Shamimu

texts.en:
Shamimu is married and has two school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a business selling Khanga (women's wrap cloth). She sells from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a resident of Sana'a, Yemen. He lives with his family in a rented house in a poor area. Ali has a University education and is an employee with a very small salary. He is the breadwinner of the family. Ali has a lot of liabilities toward his family that puts him in a very difficult condition. He strives to provide his family with a better living condition. The house where he lives with his family lacks of a lot of furniture. As a result, Ali applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary furniture for his house. Ali hopes to eventually purchase a piece of land and build his own house on it.

loans.use: To purchase some of the necessary furniture for his house.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has three children who attend school. She operates a tailoring business, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her potential clients are women and men. 

Mariam requested a loan from Yehu for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Absalom's Group

texts.en:
Absalom is 69 years old and has nine children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by six farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Absalom has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Absalom also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Absalom's Group will be able to receive a total of four solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is a 36-year-old married woman, and a mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than two years now. 

Arlen is asking to take a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and snack foods and others. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Arlen hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments,  bread and snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Raim Group

texts.en:
Raim is a 33-year-old, married farmer with three children, who lives in the Tbong Khmum Province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer for over 14 years thus far. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is a 35-year-old farmer. Both Raim and her husband can make approximately $11 per day. 

She is requesting a group loan for three members and she will use her portion to buy construction materials to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions. For her future goals, she wants to buy more farmland to cultivate rice, renovate her house, and help her children finish high school.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a latrine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joesph is 28 years old and lives in the town of Mundri County of South Sudan. He is responsible, and he has been working hard to manage the shop. A loan of 1,200 SSP helps Joseph to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his store.

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en: Yusta, a married woman with four children, lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her business is operating a ladies salon where she has worked for seven years. She ventured into business with an aim of raising revenue for the family. Yusta complains of limited capital to put her salon to a standard that her customers desire. However, her family dream is educating all her children. She will use the loan to buy equipment like a steamer, smoother, braids, weaves and hair oils to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment like a steamer, smoother, braids, weaves and hair oils to use in her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy dairy products, sodas, and supplies to sell ice cream and make chocolate bananas

loans.name: Lila Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (Georgina, Beatriz y Laurenda) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos; se organizaron hace aproximadamente un año para accesar a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.   

Laurenda: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer amable, con cualidades de líder, es casada, tiene  tres hijos, menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera formal, como contador en una institución del gobierno. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, desde  hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos que compra en la comunidad miskita cercana a Bilwi que se llama Lamlaya (agua mansa).  Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three women (Georgina, Beatriz and Laurenda) from the Miskito ethnic group from Bilwi in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. These women are entrepreneurs who struggle daily to grow their small businesses of selling seafood. They were organized about a year ago in order to access joint guarantees from Pana Pana.

Laurenda is a member of the solidarity group. She is a kind woman, with leadership qualities, and married with three minor children. Her husband works on a formal basis as an accountant in a government institution.

In order to support the household expenses she has been selling fish and seafood for seven years that she buys in the Miskito community called Lamlaya (still waters) near Bilwi.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish and seafood products to sell to increase her earnings and service more people asking for this product which is one of the basic staples in Bilwi.

She dreams of having enough capital to establish a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more fish and seafood proucts

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en:
Sabuhi is a 25-year-old man. He is married and he has a son. Sabuhi lives in Imishli with his family. He has been working at washing cars for three years. His work is not useful to provide for the family, but Sabuhi always trying to solve all needs. 

His monthly income is 150 manta, but this money is not enough for his family.

Sabuhi hardly buys food for his family with this money. But he has a land and water problem doesn't allow him to grow vegetables or trees on his land.

Now he decided to supply water to his land; in this way he will change his life for the better. For this reason he applied for 1,000 AZN from Kiva; please help him.

loans.use: to supply water to his land

loans.name: Sarbaroy

texts.en:
Sarbaroy is a old woman who lives in Konibodom town. She is very kind and polite. She is sitting at home and looks after her grandson. Her son is engaged in machine repair, and her daughter-in-law is working at the hospital as nurse. Her older son and his wife immigrated to Russia. 

Currently Sarbaroy wants to start a livestock activity. She is planning to purchase livestock and with her daughter's help, create her business.  

Sarbaroy has a barn and other conditions for the care of animals. It is the basic reason for requesting the loan. With your support she will be able to develop her life and provide her family with dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 47-year-old married father of three children, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He has had a fruit and vegetable cart for 26 years. Throughout the years he has been working hard to cover the needs and expenses of his family, and provide them with better living conditions inside the camp.

Mohammad is an ambitious man who has a good reputation among his region, as he is suffering from the hard financial conditions of the people inside the camp. However, he is trying desperately to develop his business. 

So Mohammad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy wood planks in order to make a new cart which will help him increase his business merchandise with new kinds of fruits and vegetables. This loan will help him satisfy his customers' needs and attract new ones.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood planks in order to make a new cart

loans.name: Hermelina

texts.en:
Hermelina is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother two grown children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the dressmaking business for more than 30 years now. She has a small dress shop. Hermelina is asking to take a loan to buy more cloth, thread, needles, and other dressmaking materials. With a loan, she will be able to improve her materials, thus allowing her to make more dresses for her shop to sell. 

In the future, Hermelina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more cloth, thread, needles, and other dressmaking materials.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan and her nice family live in Nizami village of Ararat region. The family consists of her husband, parents-in-law and two little children. The family has been involved in farming for many years. 

The farm they run includes arable land (where they cultivate potatoes) and a greenhouse, where tomatoes and cucumbers are cultivated. 
Ruzan and her family work hard to gather each harvest and run their farm successfully. 

To be able to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and cover the fuel costs for heating the greenhouse, Ruzan has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her with farming costs. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides and cover the fuel costs for heating the greenhouse

loans.name: Yulin

texts.en:
Yulin, a 51-year-old man, is divorced with one daughter and two aging parents. He has no offspring with his current girlfriend for her sterility. The family has long been bogged down in poverty. They live in a dilapidated house and cannot afford a remodel. As the breadwinner in the family, Yulin has been raising cows for a living for 13 years, with the help of his parents. However, as the parents have gotten older, the family has difficulty in managing its animal raising. 

With a dream to help the his family live a better life Yulin hired two workers to help in raising the cows, and he also wants to raise some sheep and poultry to increase the family income. He hopes one day that his family could live in a bigger house and his parents could have a rest.

Yulin requested ￥15,000 from MircoCred. It is the fourth time he has requested money. 

With the money, he has managed to use part of the money to hire two workers to help him expand the scale of his farming to gain more income. The rest of the money will be used to support his family.

loans.use: to hire two workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove to make pupusas, to expand her business, and to buy corn, tomatoes, meats, peppers, and onions, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Consuelo comenta que está muy satisfecha y agradecida por haber tenido acceso a esta gran oportunidad con los fondos KIVA a través de COMIXMUL, lograr cumplir sus planes y metas propuestas en la temporada pasada que eran los de llevar a cabo la fertilización de la propiedad de café mediante la compra de abonos, urea, formulas, una bomba de mochila y el pago de la mano de obra para asistir 2 manzanas de café, la elaboración de un vivero de cinco mil plantas y poder vender las mismas una parte y la otra sembrarla en estos próximos días. Ella manifiesta '' Si no hubiese obtenido ese préstamo no fuese posible darle mantenimiento a la propiedad y no podría obtener una buena ''. En esta nueva ocasión ella solicita ser apoyada nuevamente por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para nuevamente comprar los diferentes insumos agrícolas y llevar a cabo la fertilización en esta nueva temporada la cual se aplicara al vivero de café y a la plantilla sembrada para que al final de la temporada esta de fruto y salir adelante con su negocio pues ella cree que de esta manera y con este apoyo ella podrá seguir cumpliendo sus metas y es la ampliación de su plantación de café ya que piensa sembrar una manzana más de tierra, hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitacion la cual necesita y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Consuelo is pleased and grateful to have had access to the opportunities that Kiva funds, through COMIXMUL, made possible for her. She was able to complete her plans and meet her goals last season, purchasing and applying the supplies and labor she needed to fertilize her 2 parcels of coffee plantation. She was also able to build a greenhouse for 5000 plants, selling some and planting others within a few days.  She says, "If it hadn't been for that loan, it would never have been possible to tend the land, and I wouldn't have gotten a good harvest."

This season, she is looking for support from Kiva investors to do it all again. She'll purchase the different agricultural supplies she needs and fertilize her coffee seedlings in the greenhouse as well as the planted crops. That way, by the end of this season they'll be in fruit and she'll be able to continue with her business. She believes that with this support and with her plans, she'll be able to keep meeting her goals, expanding her coffee plantation to include another parcel.  She'll also be able to make needed repairs to her home and support her children's education.

loans.use: buy farming supplies to grow coffee and pay for manual labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy building supplies

loans.name: Eyyub

texts.en:
Eyyub is married and has two children. His son is married, and his daughter goes to 10 class. Narmin is Eyyub’s wife; she is a nurse. Eyyub lives with his family in Absheron region. Eyyub has a car, and for ten years, he has been a taxi driver. He transports passengers between different areas of Absheron region. Today his car is damaged, and Eyyub can’t support his family. He wants to repair the car and restore his monthly income. Therefore, he applied to Komak for a loan amount of 1,000 AZN. With this loan he wants to buy a new motor for his car.

He is thankful for this loan from Kiva and Komak organization. In the future he wants to repair the interior of his car.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his car

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “CRISTO ASENCION DE RUMICHACA”; el Banco Comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua dedicándose a  la compra y venta de artesanía ella elabora textiles, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual e va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua tejiendo  mantas, guantes, ponchos, chalinas, entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lanas, botones entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank "Cristo Asencion de Rumichaca," which is located in the province and district of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

She continues in her business of buying and selling crafts and making textiles. She has spent some time running this business and it's going well for her thanks to the hard work that she brings to it every day. She continues to weave blankets, gloves, shawls, cravats, and more, which provides her a way of earning a living for her family. She is requesting this loan to buy wool, buttons, and more. Gregoria is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: buy wool, buttons, and more

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 43 membres fait partie du banc villageois depuis le 13 décembre 2008. La plupart des femmes font du commerce et de l’embouche.
NDOUMBE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 40 ans .Elle est veuve et est mère de 08 enfants dont 02 garçons et 06 filles.
Elle envisage faire du petit commerce. Elle achète des parfums à 25000f et les revend avec un bénéfice de 25000f. Elle achète du mil à150f le kg et le revend à 185f le kg.
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’épargner et de payer les intérêts de son prêt dans le banc villageois .Elle lui permet aussi d’assurer la dépense journalière de la famille.
texts.en:
This group of 43 members has been part of the banc villageois since December 13, 2008. Most of the women [in the group] are in business or livestock farming. Ndoumbe, standing at right in the photo with her hand raised, is 40 years old. She is a widow and the mother of eight children, two boys and six girls.

Ndoumbe plans to run a small business. She [will] purchase perfume for 25,000 [CFA] francs and resell it for a profit of 25,000 francs. She [will] purchase millet for 150 [CFA] francs per kilogram and resell it for 185 francs per kilogram.

The profits will allow Ndoumbe to save and to pay the interest on her loan to the banc villageois. They will also allow her to see to the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase millet and perfume.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Doña Deisy inició su primera actividad productiva con un préstamo de su Empresa Comunal; el primero de su vida. Inició con tres cerdos hace ya un año con el proyecto. Con las ganancias de la venta de estos animales y otro préstamo de EC San Andrés, Doña Deisy cría cinco nuevos cerdos. Su deseo es ampliar la galera donde los tiene para asegurar la salubridad de sus animales, adquirir nuevos cerdos, incrementar sus ventas y con ello sus ingresos, mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia. Es por esto que solicita un crédito de dos mil cien dólares (2.100) para terminar con su proyecto.
texts.en: Deis began her first productive business with a loan from Empresa Comunal, the first of her life. She started out her project with three pigs a year ago. With the money she earned from selling these animals and another loan from EC San Andrés, Deisy raised five more pigs. Her goal is to expand the pen where she keeps her animals, ensuring their health. She also hopes to acquire new pigs, increase her sales, and thus her earnings, improving her family's living conditions. This is why she's requesting this loan for $2100 dollars, so that she can complete her project.

loans.use: expand her pen for raising pigs

loans.name: Verónica Margarita

texts.es:
Verónica, es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad, ella está casada y solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, actualmente su esposo trabaja en un proyecto de apoyo a niños, han procreado 3 hijas lo cual conforman su nucleo familiar.

Verónica tiene una tienda desde hace un año pues fue un hermano quien le dio la oportunidad de administrar dicho negocio que él poseía; además ella vende comida en las zonas aledañas, siendo sus hijas quienes se involucran en las actividad productivas que realiza lo cual les permiten salir adelante y obtener el sustento de cada día.


El crédito que ella solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en su tienda, para comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, consomes, paquetes de chocolate en polvo, azúcar, café entre otros productos que le hacen falta en en el negocio, de esta manera Verónica podrá suplir su necesidad y satisfacer la demanda de clientes.

El sueño de Verónica es tener un restaurante y una tienda mas grande, y también sueña con ver a sus tres hijas convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
Veronica, a hardworking 38 year old woman, is married and was only able to complete ninth grade.  Currently, her husband is working on a project to support children.  They have three children within their nuclear family.

Veronica has owned a store for one year, and it was her brother who gave her the opportunity to manage the business that he owned.  In addition, she sells food in the surrounding areas.  Her daughters are involved in productive activities that permit them to get ahead and make a living.

She needs the loan she is requesting to invest in her store, and she will purchase rice, beans, soup, chocolate powder packets, sugar, coffee, and other products that she needs in her business.  In this way, Veronica will be able to meet her needs and satisfy customer demand.  

Veronica’s dream is to have a restaurant and a larger store, and she also dreams of seeing her three daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, soup, chocolate powder packets, sugar, coffee, and other products that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his wife and one granddaughter. He works as a jewelry instructor. He suffers from cataracts in the eyes, which is really common. This eye problem has been affecting his vision for quite some time. He has been using glasses for a very long time and now it has become uncomfortable because he cannot perform his job duties. Because of the type of work that he does, his vision is really important. A few months back he realized that he was losing vision in both eyes. He needs the eye surgery right away. He is using this loan to pay for his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married with two children. He has a small family business that he runs with his wife (small pharmacy). They work hard to support their family, and this is the only income they have. He is a hardworking and responsible father. A few months ago his wife was diagnosed with an eye retina problem and needs surgery. Due to economic reasons in the past, he was not able to have the surgery performed. He is using this loan to help his wife to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Higidia

texts.es:
La socia Higidia  se sigue dedicando al negocio confecciones como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, pantalones y blusas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 40 años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de costurera. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar telas, tijeras e hilos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Higidia is continuing with her dressmaking business, where she makes pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, and other garments.  She works from 8am until 6pm, and she has 40 years of experience with this line of work.  Her dream is to expand her dressmaking business.  

Higidia is requesting a loan to buy fabric, scissors, and thread.  

Higidia is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, and thread

loans.name: Héctor Eduardo

texts.es:
Héctor es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su abuela a quien él apoya económicamente, actualmente está estudiando técnico en computación los fines de semana, él está cubriendo sus gastos de estudios pues sus padres emigraron hacia otro país y no recibe apoyo de ellos.

Héctor trabaja como administrador en un cyber en el mismo lugar donde él reside, y administra uno más en otro municipio, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace dos años de lunes a viernes de 8:00 A.M a 8:00 P.M, y los fines de semana estudia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar una motocicleta para viajar a los lugares donde administra los negocios, y así poder movilizarse de un lado a otro sin problemas y sin pérdida de tiempo.

Este joven sueña con seguir trabajando para tener algún día un negocio propio y así lograr más ingresos para cuando decida formar su propia familia, además sueña con culminar sus estudios para conseguir mejor oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Hector, a young 23 year old entrepreneur, lives with his grandmother, whom he supports financially.  Currently, he is studying for a technical degree in computers on the weekends.  He is covering the expenses for his studies because his parents emigrated to another country, and he doesn’t receive support from them.

Hector is manager of a cyber café located in his home, and also manages one in another town.  He has been engaged in this work, from Monday to Friday, 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M, for two years.  He studies on the weekends.

He needs the loan to purchase a motorcycle to travel to the paces where he manages the businesses, and thus move from one place to another smoothly and without delay.

This young man dreams of continuing to work, and some day having his own business.  In this way, he will have more income for when he decides to start his own family.  He also dreams of completing his studies, and gaining better job opportunities.

loans.use: to travel to the paces where he manages the businesses, and thus move from one place to another smoothly and without delay.

loans.name: Ecatepec Group

texts.en:
The members of Ecatepec Group are Mexican farmers who live in one of the 800 localities of the State of Oaxaca without plans to be electrified by power lines. They decided to install Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their houses in order to have a basic electricity service. Funding is asked for financing those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these men pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.
 
Severo, standing seventh from the left in the back row, is a 36-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and four young children in a remote house. Now, with the four hours of lighting provided by the three lamps of the SSHS, the two sons and two daughters of Severo may do their homework more easily.

loans.use: to pay for PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es:
La socia Margoth se dedica al trabajo como cantante, la socia canta en diferentes eventos como matrimonios, bautizos y cumpleaños, la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere abrir una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Margoth works as a singer. She sings at various events such as weddings, baptisms, and birthdays.  Through this work, she wants to open a grocery store. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy sound equipment. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase sound equipment.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 5 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 54, lives in her own home with her husband.  For five years, she has owned a small store located in her home where she sells candy, soft drinks, basic grain, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar and other products, and she has many customers because of her good prices. She is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale merchandise because this is her only source of income and, in this way, she will have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase candy, soft drinks, basic grain, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatin, sugar and other products,

loans.name: Blanco Zamalloa

texts.es:
La socia Lourdes pertenece al banco comunal TERESA DE JESUS, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a ejerce su carrera de arquitecta, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa pública en el área de obras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma apoyar a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
La socia se siente agradecida y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lourdes is in the Teresa de Jesus communal bank. She juggles her daily tasks with her career in architecture. She works in a public enterprise in the area of construction.

She has been in her job for a good time. Her work is going well due to the effort that she puts in every day. She wants to continue working because this is how she provides for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy a laptop. She is grateful and commits to making the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Susan Lourdes

texts.es:
La socia Susan  pertenece al banco comunal JUNTOS PODEMOS, la socia tiene 43 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de accesorios de autopartes de autos, la socia vende parabrisas, faros entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de parabrisas, faros entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Susan is a member of Juntos Podemos Communal Bank.  She's 43 years old and single, and she alternates her daily activities with her business selling windshields, headlights, and other car parts.  She has had her business for some time now and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep supporting her family.

Susan's requesting the loan to buy windshields, headlights, and other parts.

She's grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy windshields, headlights, and other car parts

loans.name: Iris Eunice

texts.es: Doña Iris es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y una pequeña de 10 años. Como madre soltera ha luchado sola toda su vida para sacar adelante a sus hijos. La venta de mercancía seca y buhonería le ha ayudado en los últimos 13 años a salir adelante, darle estudio a sus hijos y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su pequeño bazar, llamado Novedades Sashell, se ha quedado pequeño para colocar a la vista de los clientes las mercancías que ofrece. Por ello solicita un préstamo de $2,100 para invertir en la compra de materiales y la mano de obra para la ampliación de su bazar. Con este préstamo ella espera ampliar sus ventas, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Iris is the mother of three children, two of whom are now grown, while the youngest is ten years old. As a single mother, she has fought her entire life to get her children ahead. Selling assorted dry goods has helped her for the last thirteen years as she sent her children through school and improved their quality of life. Her tiny bazaar, called Novedades Sashell (Sashell's Novelties) has remained small so as to catch the eye of her customers, drawing attention to the goods she sells. She is requesting this loan for $2100 to invest in buying materials and paying for the labor to expand her stall. With this loan, she hopes to expand her sales, increase her earnings, and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: expand her sales space

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana tiene 36 años de edad, acompañada y por factores económicos ella no pudo estudiar cursando únicamente su primer año de educación. El conyugue de doña Juana es una persona dedicada al campo igual que ella la siembra y cultivo de café es el rubro de ingresos económicos en su hogar en el cual viven sus 4 hijos y 3 de ellos están estudiando involucrándose únicamente ellos en las diferentes actividades de campo que son posibles mientras llega la temporada de corte donde es contratado personal para hacer más eficiente la recolección del mismo. Como anteriormente ella manifiesta no hay otra fuente de ingresos económicos solo la actividad y rubro del café actividad que aprendió a muy temprana edad en compañía de sus padres. Doña Juana solicita ser apoyada financiera mente para la compra de fertilizantes abonos, foliares y pagar mano de obra para limpiar y abonar la propiedad la cual es aproximadamente de 4 manzanas. Ella manifiesta que con este apoyo financiero mejorara la propiedad, la cosecha será más provechosa debido a la atención, cuidado y protección que se le dará a la misma incrementando la productividad y mejorando las ganancias las cuales servirán para tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir mejorando su negocio. Como metas a corto plazo es la atención personalizada de su propiedad dar el cuidado que la misma necesita para salir adelante y poder por medio de los ingresos apoyar a sus hijos en sus metas, sueños como también seguir fortaleciendo el patrimonio de la familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old and is married. For financial reasons, she was unable to study and only completed her first year of schooling. Her spouse is a person dedicated to farming just like she is. Planting and cultivating coffee is the source of financial income in their home where their 4 children live. Three of them are studying, and only get involved in the different farming activities that are possible while the harvest season approaches and workers are contracted to make the harvest of coffee more efficient.

As it was mentioned earlier, there is no other form of income besides the occupation of coffee planting, which she learned at an early age in the company of her parents. Juana is requesting the financial support to buy fertilizers, compost, liquid plant food, and pay for manual labor to clean and fertilize the property which is approximately 4 plots of land.

She mentions that with this financial support she will improve the property, and the harvest will be more fruitful because of the attention, care and protection that it will be given. This will increase the productivity and improve the earnings, which will help her to have a better quality of life and continue improving her business. Her short term goals are to give her property the personalized attention and protection it needs in order to get ahead. Through her earnings she wants to support her children in their goals and dreams as well as continue strengthening the family legacy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, liquid plant food, and pay for manual labor to help with planting coffee.

loans.name: Arroyo Mexico Group

texts.en:
